annotations.shortDefinition: A request for a diagnostic service
annotations.definition: A request for a diagnostic investigation service to be performed

A nested type in DiagnosticOrder: The specific diagnostic investigations that are requested as part of this request. Sometimes, there can only be one item per request, but in most contexts, more than one investigation can be requested

annotation.definition: A code that identifies a particular diagnostic investigation that has been requested

annotation.shortDefinition: If this item relates to specific specimens
annotation.definition: If the item is related to a specific speciment
annotation.comment: A single specimen should not appear in both DIagnosticOrder.specimen and DiagnosticOrder.item.specimen

annotation.definition: Anatomical location where the request test should be performed

annotation.shortDefinition: requested | received | accepted | inprogress | review | complete | suspended | rejected | failed
annotation.definition: The status of this individual item within the order
annotation.comment: If the request has multiple items that have their own life cycles, then the items will have their own status while the overall diagnostic order is (usually) "in progress"

annotation.definition: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred as this item of the request is processed

annotations.definition: A nested type in DiagnosticOrder: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred as the request is processed

annotation.shortDefinition: requested | received | accepted | inprogress | review | complete | suspended | rejected | failed
annotation.definition: The status for the event

annotation.shortDefinition: The date at which the event happened
annotation.definition: The date/time at which the event occurred
The person who was responsible for performing or recording the action

binding.name: DiagnosticOrderStatus
binding.definition: The status of a diagnostic order

code.definition: The request has been placed
The receiving system has received the order, but not yet decided whether it will be performed
The receiving system has accepted the order, but work has not yet commenced
The work to fulfill the order is happening
The work is complete, and the outcomes are being reviewed for approval
The work has been complete, the report(s) released, and no further work is planned
The request has been held by originating system/user request
The receiving system has declined to fulfill the request
The diagnostic investigation was attempted, but due to some procedural error, it could not be completed

annotation.definition: Who or what the investigation is to be performed on. This is usually a human patient, but diagnostic tests can also be requested on animals, groups of humans or animals, devices such as dialysis machines, or even locations (typically for environmental scans)
The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the investigation
Identifiers assigned to this order by the order or by the receiver

annotation.shortDefinition: The encounter that this diagnostic order is associated with
annotation.definition: A encounter that provides additional informaton about the healthcare context in which this request is made
An explanation or justification for why this diagnostic investigation is being requested
annotation.comment: This may be used to decide how the diagnostic investigation will be performed, or even if it will be performed at all

annotation.shortDefinition: If the whole order relates to specific specimens
annotation.definition: One or more specimens that the diagnostic investigation is about
annotation.comment: Many investigation requests will create a need for specimens, but the request itself is not actually about the specimens. This is provided for when the diagnostic investigation is requested on already existing specimens

annotation.shortDefinition: requested | received | accepted | inprogress | review | complete | suspended | rejected | failed
annotation.definition: The status of the order
annotation.comment: Typically the system placing the order sets the status to requested. There after, the order is maintained by the receiver that updates the status as the request is handled

annotation.shortDefinition: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle
annotation.definition: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred as the request is processed
annotation.comment: This is not the same as an audit trail - it is a view of the important things that happened in the past. Typically, there would only be one entry for any given status, and systems may not record all the status events

annotation.definition: The specific diagnostic investigations that are requested as part of this request. Sometimes, there can only be one item per request, but in most contexts, more than one investigation can be requested
annotation.comment: There would always be at least one item in normal usage, but this is optional so that a workflow can quote order details without having to list the items

search.name: orderer
search.description: Who ordered the test

search.description: requested | received | accepted | inprogress | review | complete | suspended | rejected | failed

search.name: status
search.description: requested | received | accepted | inprogress | review | complete | suspended | rejected | failed

annotations.shortDefinition: A Diagnostic report - a combination of request information, atomic results, images, interpretation, and formatted reports
annotations.definition: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients and/or specimens. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretation, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports
annotations.comment: This is intended to capture a single report,and is not suitable for use in displaying summary information that covers multiple reports. A typical example is a laboratory cumulative report format
annotations.requirements: To support reporting for any diagnostic report into a clinical data repository.
annotations.rimMapping: Observation[isNormalAct() and subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and domainMember("LabObservationType", code)]
annotations.committeeNotes: It's not clear how to handle cumulative reports

annotations.definition: A nested type in DiagnosticReport: Details concerning a single pathology test requested.

annotation.definition: The encounter that this diagnostic investigation is associated with
annotation.requirements: Some institutions track and file diagnostic reports under a specific encounter
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./inboundRelationship[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#ENC", code) and moodCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()])
annotation.todo: Question whether this is 80%

annotation.definition: The local ID assigned to the order by the order requester.
annotation.comment: Equivalent to the Placer Order Identifier
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="FLFS" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and subsumes("ActMood#RQO", moodCode) and isNormalAct()]/id[scope="OBJ" and displayable="true"])
annotation.todo: Reckon this is not 80%

annotation.definition: The local ID assigned to the test order by the diagnostic service provider
annotation.comment: Usually equivalent to the DICOM Accession Number and the Filler Order Identifier.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued
annotation.todo: Reckon this is not 80%

annotation.definition: Identification of pathology test requested,
annotation.comment: Useful where the test requested differs from the test actually performed.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to report what diagnostic test swere requested (not always the same as what is delivered)

annotation.definition: Anatomical location where the request test should be performed
annotation.comment: This is often implicit or explicit in the requested test, and doesn't need to be specified if so
annotation.v2Mapping: OBX-20-Observation Site (need to distinguish requested site from site actually performed at)

annotation.definition: Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the diagnostic service
annotation.requirements: The requesting clinician may need to be contacted concerning the method or interpretation of the diagnostic service, and is frequently used for billing purposes too
annotation.rimMapping:
Practitioner: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/role[subsumesCode("RoleClass#ASSIGN", classCode)]
Organization: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/role[subsumesCode("RoleClass#ASSIGN", classCode)]/scoper[subsumesCode("EntityClass#ORG", classCode) and determinerCode="INSTANCE" and code[isNormalDatatype]])

annotation.definition: Details of the clinical information provided to the diagnostic service along with the original request
annotation.requirements: Knowing the clinical information may influence the interpretation of the result
annotation.v2Mapping: OBR-13-Relevant Clinical Information (could also be in NTE-3 or OBR-18, 19, 20, 21)

annotations.definition: A nested type in DiagnosticReport: A group of results. Results may be grouped by specimen, or by some value in DiagnosticReport.resultGroup.name to describe what binds all the results together.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name/Code for this group of results
annotation.definition: A code or name that describes this group of results. For the base group, this is the report name
annotation.comment: Examples of nested report groups: the antibody code for a goup of antibody related test, or the organism code for a group of isolate/sensitivities, or a set of perinatal measurements on a single fetus.
annotation.v2Mapping: OBR-4-Universal Service ID (V2 doesn't provide an easy way to indicate both the ordered test and the performed panel)

annotation.definition: Details about the individual specimen to which these 'Result group' test results refer
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to report information about the collected specimens on which the report is based

annotation.definition: A sub-group in a report group. Sub groups can be grouped in arbitrary ways. The group.name defines the purpose and interpretation of the grouping
annotation.comment: Nested report groups beyond the first level are not used often, but arise in structured pathology reports, and where there is more than one sensitivity assessment per discovered organism

annotation.definition: Specific detailed result, including both the value of the result item and additional information that may be useful for clinical interpretation. Results include whatever specific data items pathology labs report as part of the clinical service; it is not confined to measurements.
annotation.requirements: Need to report results with information that assist with interpretation
annotation.rimMapping: ./outboundRelationship[typeCode="COMP" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and isNormalAct() and fromDomain(code, "LabObservationResult")]

binding.name: DiagnosticRequests
binding.definition: codes for tests/services that can be performed by diagnostic services

binding.name: BodySite
binding.definition: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality

binding.name: DiagnosisCodes
binding.definition: Diagnoses codes provided as adjuncts to the report

binding.name: DiagnosticReportNames
binding.definition: Codes that describe Diagnostic Reports

binding.name: DiagnosticServiceSection
binding.definition: codes for diagnostic service sections

annotation.definition: The status of the diagnostic report as a whole
annotation.comment: This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications need to take appropriate action if a report is withdrawn
annotation.requirements: Diagnostic services routinely issue provisional/incomplete reports, and sometimes withdraw previously released reports.

annotation.definition: The date and/or time that this version of the report was released from the source diagnostic service
annotation.comment: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the record (potentially a secondary copy), not the actual release time of the report
annotation.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the report was released
annotation.rimMapping: firstOf(unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="VRF" and isNormalParticipation()]/time[type="TS"]), unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/time[type="TS"]))

annotation.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources
annotation.requirements: Must know the subject context
annotation.v2Mapping: PID-3-Patient ID List (no V2 mapping for Group or Device)

annotation.definition: The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report
annotation.comment: This is not necessarily the source of the atomic data items - it's the entity that takes responsibility for the clinical report
annotation.requirements: Need to know who to contact if there are queries about the results. Also may need to track the source of reports for secondary data analysis
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/role[subsumesCode("RoleClass#ASSIGN", classCode)]/scoper[subsumesCode("EntityClass#ORG", classCode) and determinerCode="INSTANCE"])

annotation.shortDefinition: Id for external references to this report
annotation.definition: The local ID assigned to the report by the order filler, usually by the Information System of the diagnostic service provider
annotation.requirements: Need to know what identifier to use when making queries about this report from the source laboratory, and for linking to the report outside FHIR context
annotation.v2Mapping: OBR-51-Observation Group ID (todo: check semantic intent of OBR-51 with OOWG)

annotation.definition: Details concerning a single pathology test requested.
annotation.comment: Note: Usually there is one test request for each result, however in some circumstances multiple test requests may be represented using a single Pathology test result resource. Note that there are also cases where one request leads to multiple reports
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued and also to report what diagnostic tests were requested (not always the same as what is delivered)
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="FLFS" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and subsumes("ActMood#PRMS", moodCode) and isNormalAct()])

annotation.definition: The section of the diagnostic service that performs the examination e.g. biochemistry, haematology, MRI
annotation.requirements: Help clinicians filter/find the reports they are looking for
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="COMP" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#LIST", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and inDomain(code,"Lab Service") and isNormalAct()]/code

annotation.definition: The diagnostically relevant time for this report
annotation.comment: If the diagnostic procedure was performed on the patient, this is the time it was peformed. If there is specimens, the diagnostically relevant time can be derived from the specimen collection times, but the specimen information is not always available, and nor is the exact relationship is not always automatic
annotation.requirements: Need to know where in the patient history to file/present this report

annotation.definition: A group of results. Results may be grouped by specimen, or by some value in DiagnosticReport.resultGroup.name to describe what binds all the results together.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to report groups of results, where the result grouping is arbitrary, but meaningful. This structure is recursive - groups can can contain groups. The base group doesn't usually contain a group name, but nested groups always do
annotation.rimMapping: ./outboundRelationship[typeCode="COMP" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[isNormalAct() and subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and fromDomain(code, "LabObservationBattery")]

annotation.shortDefinition: Key images associated with this report
annotation.definition: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and maybe directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest)
annotation.comment: An imaging study is a list of images following a DICOM specification - only list one of these, or multiple images

annotation.definition: Concise and clinically contextualised narrative interpretation of the diagnostic report
annotation.comment: Typically, a report is either [all data, no narrative (e.g. Core lab)] or [a mix of data with some concluding narrative (e.g. Structured Pathology Report, Bone Density)], or [all narative (e.g. typical imaging report, histopathology)]. In all these cases, the narrative goes in "text"
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to provide a conclusion that is not lost amongst the basic result data
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SPRT" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and mapsTo(code, "LOINC# 48767-8") and isNormalAct()]/value[type="ST"])

annotation.definition: Codes for the conclusion
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SPRT" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and subsumesCode(code, "LOINC# 54531-9") and isNormalAct()]/value[type="CD"])

annotation.definition: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they must be semantically equivalent.
annotation.comment: Possible formats: text/html, text/plain, text/rtf, application/msword, application/pdf, application/rtf, application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.text, application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document. Application/pdf is recommended as the most reliable and interoperable in this context
annotation.requirements: Laboratory needs to be able to provide it's own fully formatted report for clinical fidelity

example.name: Assorted Collection
example.description: Various reports gathered from v2 messages

example.name: Report Feed
example.description: Snapshot of a live feed from a laboratory

annotations.shortDefinition: A document that contains resources
annotations.definition: A documentation of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single statement of meaning that establishes its own context. A document is composed of a set of resources that include both human and computer readable portions. A human may attest to the accuracy of the human readable portion and may authenticate and/or sign the entire whole. A document may be kept as a set of logically linked resources, or they may be bundled together in an atom feed
annotations.comment: While the focus of this specification is on patient-specific clinical documents, this resource can also apply to other healthcare-related documents such as study protocol designs, healthcare invoices and other activities that are not necessarily patient-specific or clinical
annotations.requirements: For document based framework

annotations.definition: A nested type in Document: Identifies a main topic within the document's table of contents

annotation.definition: A code identifying the kind of content contained within the section
Identifies the primary subject of the section.
annotation.comment: This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications must be aware if the subject changes for a particular section
annotation.requirements: Provides context as to the potential accuracy of the information
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="PAT"]) or unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="IDENT"]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "ORG") and isNormalEntity()])

annotation.shortDefinition: The actual data for the section
annotation.definition: Identifies the discrete data that provides the content for the section.
annotation.comment: Because documents represent point-in-time snapshots, resource references should generally be to a specific version.
annotation.todo: This may need to be 0..*. May need to consider adding text here to to account for missing resources.

annotation.definition: Identifies a subtopic within the section as part of the document's table of contents

annotations.definition: A nested type in Document: A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the document

annotation.definition: The type of attestation the authenticator offers
annotation.requirements: Identifies when the information in the document was deemed accurate. (Things may have changed since then.)

annotation.definition: When document was attested by the party
annotation.requirements: Identifies who has taken on the responsibility for accuracy of the document content.

annotation.definition: Who attested the document in the specified way
annotation.requirements: Used for routing and also provides context as to intended audience.
annotation.rimMapping: ./role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()] or ./role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole and not(player)]/scoper[determinerCode="INST" and classCode="ORG" and isNormalEntity()]

annotations.definition: A nested type in Document: The main event/act/item, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented

annotation.shortDefinition: Code(s) that apply to the event being documented
annotation.definition: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the typeCode, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.
annotation.comment: An event can further specialize the act inherent in the typeCode, such as where it is simply "Procedure Report" and the procedure was a "colonoscopy". If one or more eventCodes are included, they shall not conflict with the values inherent in the classCode, practiceSettingCode or typeCode, as such a conflict would create an ambiguous situation. This short list of codes is provided to be used as key words for certain types of queries.

annotation.shortDefinition: The period covered by the document
annotation.definition: The period of time covered by the document. There is no assertion that the document is a complete representation for this period, only that it documents events during this time

annotation.shortDefinition: Full details for the event(s) the document concents
annotation.definition: Full details for the event(s) the document concents
annotation.requirements: Provides context for the document and supports searching.

binding.name: DocumentAttestationMode
binding.definition: The way in which a person authenticated a document

code.definition: The person authenticated the document in their personal capacity
The person authenticated the document in their professional capacity
The person authenticated the document and accepted legal responsibility for its content
The organization authenticated the document as consistent with their policies and procedures

binding.name: DocumentSectionCode
binding.definition: Classification of a clinical document section

binding.name: DocumentStatus
binding.definition: The workflow/clinical status of this document

code.definition: This is an initial or interim document. The content may be incomplete or unverified
The document is complete and verified by an appropriate person
The document has been modified subsequent to being released as "final", and is complete and verified by an authorised person
The document has been withdrawn following prior release

binding.name: DocumentEventCode
binding.definition: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts being documented

binding.name: DocumentConfidentiality
binding.definition: Codes specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document

binding.name: DocumentType
binding.definition: Type of a clinical document

annotation.definition: Logical Identifier for the document, assigned when created. This identifier stays constant when subsequent versions of the document are created
annotation.comment: see discussion in resource definition for how these relate

annotation.definition: Version specific identifier for the document, assigned when created. This identifier changes when subsequent versions of the document are created
annotation.comment: see discussion in resource definition for how these relate

annotation.definition: The document creation time, when the document first came into being. Where the document is a transform from an original document in some other format, the ClinicalDocument.effectiveTime is the time the original document is created.
annotation.requirements: Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching.

annotation.definition: Specifies the particular kind of document (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note)
annotation.requirements: Key metadata element describing the document, used in searching/filtering.

annotation.shortDefinition: More detail about the document type
annotation.definition: Additional detailed type for the document
annotation.requirements: Helps humans to assess whether the document is of interest when viewing an index of documetns

annotation.definition: Official human-readable label for the document
annotation.comment: It's commonly the case that clinical documents do not have a title and are collectively referred to by the display name of Document.type (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note"). Where these display names are rendered to the clinician or where the document has a unique title, the Document.title value should be used
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to mark interim, amended, or withdrawn documents

annotation.definition: The workflow/clinical status of this document. The status is a rough guide to the clinical standing of the document
annotation.comment:
A document marked as an amendment SHOULD replace another document. However the amended flag is not the same as a replacement statement - the amendment flag is looser, and indicates that other related documents about the same thing have been released in *some* context prior to the release of this document.
If a document is marked as withdrawn, the document, or data from the document, should never be displayed to a user without being clearly marked as untrustworthy. The flag "withdrawn" is why this element is labelled as a modifier of other elements
annotation.requirements: Identifies who is responsible for the entry of the data.

annotation.definition: The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
annotation.comment: Enforcement and issues related to highly sensitive documents are beyond the scope of XDS (see security section). confidentialityCode is part of a codification scheme and value set enforced by the Document Registry.
annotation.requirements: Essential metadata for searching for the document, identifies who the document applies to

annotation.definition: Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (I.e. machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure)
annotation.comment: For clinical documents, this is usually the patient.
annotation.requirements: Provides context as to the potential accuracy of the information
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="PAT"]) or unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="IDENT"]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "ORG") and isNormalEntity()])
annotation.todo: Need to extend this to support documents with other types of subjects. Also rationalize with encounter & context elements

annotation.definition: Identifies who is responsible for the information in the document. (Not necessarily who typed it in.)
annotation.requirements: Identifies responsibility for the accuracy of the document content.

annotation.definition: A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the document
annotation.requirements: Indicates the level of officialness of the attestation.

annotation.definition: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document.
annotation.requirements: Provides context for the document and creates a linkage between a resource describing an event and the document created describing the event.
annotation.rimMapping: ./participation[typeCode="RCV" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="CUST" and isNormalRole and not (player)]/scoper[classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST" and isNormalEntity()]

annotation.definition: The main event/act/item, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented
annotation.comment: The event needs to be consistent with the type element, though can provide further information if desired

annotation.definition: Describes the clinical encounter or type of care this document is associated with.
annotation.requirements: Used to establish relationships between documents to determine which is the most current/authoritative.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(highest(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()], priorityNumber)/target[moodCode="EVN" and classCode=("ENC", "PCPR") and isNormalAct])

annotation.definition: Identifies the document this document supersedes, if any.
annotation.comment: This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications must be aware of document replacement semantics and behave appropriately
annotation.requirements: Identifies who is responsible for the entry of the data.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(highest(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="RPLC and isNormalActRelationship()], priorityNumber)/target[classCode="DOC" and moodCode="EVN" and isNormalAct]/id[isNormalDatatype() and displayable="false" and scope="OBJ" and reliability="ISS"])

annotation.shortDefinition: Additional provenance about the document and it's parts
annotation.definition: Additional provenance about the document and the resources that are the sections

annotation.shortDefinition: Stylesheet to use when rendering the document
annotation.definition: A fixed CSS stylesheet to use when rendering the documents
annotation.requirements: Support for CDA level 1

annotation.definition: An alternative representation of the document that can be used in place of the html based rendering
annotation.comment: Typically, this is application/pdf
annotation.requirements: Adds organization and human navigability to the information in the document.

annotation.definition: Identifies a main topic within the document's table of contents
annotation.requirements: Provides computable standardized labels to topics within the document.

invariant.human: A document must have a representation, one or more sections or both

annotations.shortDefinition: A reference to a document
annotations.definition: A reference to a document
annotations.comment: Usually, this is used for documents other than those defined by FHIR

annotations.definition: A nested type in DocumentReference: The clinical context in which the document was prepared

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of context (i.e. type of event)
annotation.definition: The type of clinical context, such as a kind of surgery, or a kind of speciality, or a clinical type
The time period of the patient's care that is described by the document

annotation.shortDefinition: Kind of facility where patient was seen
annotation.definition: The kind of facility where the patient was seen

annotation.definition: The name of a parameter
The value of the named parameter

annotations.definition: A nested type in DocumentReference: A description of a service call that can be used to retrieve the document

annotation.comment: The meaning and interpretation of the parameters depends on the service type

annotation.shortDefinition: Where service is located (usually a URL)
annotation.definition: Where the service end-point is located

annotation.definition: A list of named parameters that is used in the service call
annotation.comment: The interpretation of the parameters, and how to convert them into a proper service call, is dependent on the type of the service, and needs to be specified in an implementation guide somewhere

annotation.definition: Document identifier as assigned by the source of the document. This identifier is specific to this version of the document. This unique identifier may be used elsewhere to identify this version of the document
Other identifiers associated with the record

Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (I.e. machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure)
annotation.v2Mapping: PID-3-Patient ID List (No standard way to define a Practitioner or Group subject in V2 MDM message)

annotation.shortDefinition: What kind of document this is (LOINC if possible)
annotation.definition: Specifies the particular kind of document (e.g. Patient Summary, Discharge Summary, Prescription, etc)
annotation.comment: Key metadata element describing the document, used in searching/filtering.

annotation.definition: More detailed information about the document type

annotation.definition: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document

annotation.definition: Which person or organization authenticates that this document is valid
When the document was created

annotation.definition: When the document reference was created
annotation.comment: Referencing/indexing time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching.

annotation.definition: The status of this document reference
The status of the underlying document
If this document replaces another
Human Readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the "title"

annotation.definition: A code specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document

annotations.shortDefinition: Family History
annotations.definition: Significant health events and conditions for people related to the subject relevant in the context of care for the subject

A nested type in FamilyHistory: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

annotation.definition: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system
Indicates what happened as a result of this condition. If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

annotation.shortDefinition: How old the person was when the condition manifested
annotation.definition: Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded.
An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

annotations.definition: A nested type in FamilyHistory: The related person. Each FamilyHistory resource contains the entire family history for a single person.

annotation.shortDefinition: The family member who had the condition
annotation.definition: This will either be a name or a description. E.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair"
annotation.requirements: Allows greater ease in ensuring the same person is being talked about

annotation.definition: The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.) At the moment this is a code linking to a fixed set of values. I'm not sure if there is an international standard for this. A fixed (possibly extensible) set of codes feels better than a codeable concept for somehting like this...

If this resource is indicating that the related person is deceased, then an indicator of whether the person is deceased (yes) or not (no) or the age or age range or description of age at death - can be indicated here. If the reason for death is known, then it can be indicated in the outomce code of the condition - in this case the deceased property should still be set.

annotation.shortDefinition: General note about the related person
annotation.definition: This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

annotation.shortDefinition: The Condition that the related person had
annotation.definition: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

binding.name: FamilialRelationship
binding.definition: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the person with the condition. Based on the HL7v3 RoleCode: OID: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.111 with some inappropriate items removed

annotations.shortDefinition: Group of multiple entities
annotations.definition: Represents a defined collection of entities that may be discussed or acted upon collectively but which are not expected to act collectively and are not formally or legally recognized. I.e. A collection of entities that isn't an Organization
annotations.todo: We need determiner codes that indicate we're talking about a group even when we haven't specified a specific quantity

annotations.definition: A nested type in Group: Identifies the traits shared by members of the group

annotation.definition: Identifies the kind of trait being asserted
annotation.requirements: Need a formal way of identifying the characteristic being described

annotation.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group
annotation.comment: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.
annotation.requirements: The value of the characteristic is what determines group membership.

annotation.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group
annotation.comment: This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa
annotation.requirements: Sometimes group membership is determined by characteristics not possessed

binding.name: GroupType
binding.definition: Types of resources that are part of group

code.definition: Group contains "person" Patient resources
Group contains "animal" Patient resources
Group contains Device resources
Group contains Medication resources
Group contains Substance resources

binding.name: GroupCode
binding.definition: Kind of particular resource

binding.name: GroupCharacteristicValue
binding.definition: Value of descriptive member characteristic

binding.name: GroupCharacteristicType
binding.definition: List of characteristics used to describe group members. E.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

annotation.definition: A unique business identifier for this group
annotation.requirements: Allows the group to be referenced

annotation.definition: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes
annotation.requirements: Identifies what type of resources the group is made up of
annotation.rimMapping:
person: ./classCode="PSN"
animal: ./classCode="ANM"
device: ./classCode="DEV"
medication: ./classCode="MMAT" and ./playedRole[isNormalRole() and classCode="THER"]
food: ./classCode="FOOD"
annotation.committeeNotes: Do we need "mixed" groups?

annotation.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals. If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals
annotation.requirements: There are use-cases for groups that define specific collections of individuals, and other groups that define "types" of intended individuals. The requirements for both kinds of groups are similar, so we use a single resource, distinguished by this flag.

annotation.definition: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes. E.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.
annotation.comment: This would generally be omitted for Person resources

annotation.definition: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication
annotation.requirements: Used to identify the group in human communication

annotation.definition: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group
annotation.requirements: Group size is a common defining characteristic

annotation.definition: Identifies the traits shared by members of the group
annotation.requirements: Needs to be a generic mechanism for identifying what individuals can be part of a group
annotation.rimMapping: ./playedRole[isNormalRole()]/participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode="SBJ"]/act[isNormalAct and classCode="OBS" and moodCode="EVN"]

annotation.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.
annotation.requirements: Often the only thing of interest about a group is "who's in it"
annotation.committeeNotes: Is "group of groups" in the 80%?

invariant.human: Can only have members if group is "actual"
Can't have more members associated with the group than the value specified for "quantity"

annotations.definition: A nested type in List: Entries in this list

annotation.definition: The flag allows the system constructing the list to make one or more statements about the role and significance of the item in the list
annotation.comment: The flag can only be understood in the context of the List.code. If the flag means that the entry has actually been deleted from the list, the deleted element must be true. Deleted can only be used if the List.mode is "changes"
annotation.requirements: This field is present to support various clinical uses of lists, such as a discharge summary medication list, where flags specify whether the medication was added, modified, or deleted from the list

annotation.shortDefinition: If this item is actually marked as deleted
annotation.definition: True if this item is marked as deleted in the list.
annotation.comment: If the flag means that the entry has actually been deleted from the list, the deleted element must be true. Both flag and deleted can only be used if the List.mode is "changes". A deleted entry should be displayed in narrative as deleted
annotation.requirements: The flag element may contain codes that an application processing the list does not understand. However there can be no ambiguity if a list item is actually marked as "deleted"

annotation.definition: When this item was added to the list
annotation.comment: This is only useful and meaningful when the mode is "working"
annotation.requirements: The date may be significant for understanding the meaning of items in a working list

binding.name: ListItemFlag
binding.definition: Codes that provide further information about the reason and meaning of the item in the list

binding.name: ListCode
binding.definition: What the purpose of a list is

binding.name: ListEmptyReason
binding.definition: If a list is empty, why it is empty

annotation.shortDefinition: What the purpose of this list is
annotation.definition: This code defines the purpose of the list - why it was created
annotation.comment: If there is no code, the purpose of the list is implied where it is used, such as in a document section using Document.section.code
annotation.requirements: Lists often contain subsets of resources rather than an exhaustive list. The code identifies what type of subset is included

annotation.definition: The entity responsible for deciding what the contents of the list were
annotation.comment: The primary and important source is the entity that made the decisions what items are in the list. This may be software or user
annotation.requirements: Allows follow-up as well as context
annotation.rimMapping:
unique(.participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=ParticipationTypeCode#AUT]/role[isNormalRole() and classCode=REL]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=PSN and determinerCode=INST]
or
.participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=ParticipationTypeCode#AUT]/role[isNormalRole() and classCode=ASSIGNED][player[classCode!=DEV and determinerCode=INST and isNormalEntity()]]
or
.participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=ParticipationTypeCode#AUT]/role[isNormalRole() and classCode=ASSIGNED]/player[classCode=DEV and determinerCode=INST and isNormalEntity()])

annotation.definition: The date that the list was prepared
annotation.comment: The actual important date is the date of currency of the resources that were summarized, but it is usually assumed that these are current when the preparation occurs
annotation.requirements: Identifies how current the list is which affects relevance

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether items in the list have a meaningful order
annotation.definition: Whether items in the list have a meaningful order
annotation.comment: Applications SHOULD render ordered lists in the order provided, but MAY allow users to re-order based on their own preferences as well. This is marked as "is modified" because whether the list is ordered or not has may change how the reuslts are processed or displayed
annotation.requirements: Important for presentation and rendering. Lists may be sorted to place more important information first or to group related entries.

annotation.definition: How this list was prepared - whether it is a working list that is suitable for being maintained in an ongoing basis, or if it represents a snapshort of a list of items from another source, or whether it is a prepared list where items may be marked as added, modified or deleted
annotation.requirements: Lists are used in various ways, and it must be known in what way it is safe to use them

annotation.definition: Entries in this list
annotation.comment: If there are no entries in the list, an emptyReason SHOULD be provided

annotation.definition: If the list is empty, why the list is empty
annotation.comment: The various reasons for an empty list make a significant interpretation to its interpretation
annotation.requirements: Allows capturing things like "none exist" or "not asked" which can be important for most lists

invariant.human: The deleted flag can only be used if the

invariant.description: No emptyReason if list is not empty
invariant.human: A list can only have an emptyReason if it is empty

search.name: source
search.description: Source of the list

search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: item
search.description: Actual entry

search.description: What the purpose of this list is

search.description: When the list was prepared

search.description: Why list is empty

annotations.shortDefinition: Contact details and position information for a physical place
annotations.definition: Contact details and position information for a physical place that may be visited and where healthcare resources and participants may be found or contained, accomodated, or stored
A nested type in Location: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed in a KML compatible manner

annotation.definition: Longitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the longitude element in KML
Lattitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the lattitude element in KML
Altitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the altitude element in KML

binding.name: LocationType
binding.definition: Indicates what kind of location this is.

annotation.definition: Name of the location which identifies it to its users
annotation.requirements: Organization label locations in registries, need to keep track of those

annotation.definition: Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place
annotation.requirements: Humans need additional information to verify a correct location has been identifier

annotation.definition: Classification of the location
annotation.comment: There are many ways by which locations can be classified, so this element may be repeated.
annotation.requirements: For purposes of showing relevant locations in queries, we need to categorize locations
annotation.committeeNotes: Multiple, because a location can serve multiple purposes and there can be multiple ways to classify the locations in an organization.

annotation.definition: The contact details of the main communication devices present at the location
Physical location
annotation.requirements: If locations can be visited, we need to keep track of their address

annotation.definition: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed in a KML compatible manner
annotation.requirements: For mobile applications and automated route-finding knowing the exact location of the Location is required

annotation.shortDefinition: The organization that provides services at the location
annotation.definition: The organization that provides services at the location
annotation.requirements: Need to know who manages the location
annotation.todo: EK: Shouldn't that be "owns or manages"? Why introduce the fact that an organization provides services here? If this is a home location, you wouldn't mention the organization(s) providing services there?

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether the location is still used to provide services
annotation.definition: Whether the location is still used to provide services

annotation.shortDefinition: Another Location which this Location is physically inside of
annotation.definition: Another Location which this Location is physically inside of
annotation.requirements: For purposes of location, display and identification, knowing which locations are localted within other locations is important

search.name: near
search.description: The coordinates expressed as [lat],[long] (refer KML) to find locations near to (servers may search using a square rather than a circle for efficiency)

search.name: partof
search.description: The location of which this location is a part

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: address
search.description: A (part of the) address of the location

search.name: name
search.description: A (portion of the) name of the location

search.name: active
search.description: Whether to search for active or inactive locations

search.name: near-distance
search.description: A distance quantity to limit the near search to locations within a specific distance

search.name: type
search.description: A code for the type of location

annotations.shortDefinition: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content maybe inline or provided by direct reference
annotations.definition: A Photo, Video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content maybe inline or provided by direct reference

binding.name: MediaType
binding.definition: Whether the Media is a photo, video, or audio

code.definition: The media consists of one or more unmoving images
The media consists of a series of frames that capture a moving image
The media consists of a sound recording

binding.name: MediaSubtype
binding.definition: The type of acquisition equipment/process

binding.name: MediaView
binding.definition: Imaging view (projectIon) used when collecting an image

annotation.definition: Whether the media is a photo (still image), an audio recording, or a video recording
Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality

Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of it's collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers
annotation.comment: The identifier label and use can be used to determine what kind of identifier it is

annotation.definition: When the media was originally recorded. For video and audio, if the length of the recording is not insignificant, this is the end of the recording
annotation.comment: For an image including multiple frames, this is the start time

annotation.shortDefinition: Who/What this Media is a record of
annotation.definition: Who/What this Media is a record of

annotation.shortDefinition: Who asked that this image be collected
annotation.definition: Who requested that this image be collected
annotation.comment: Helps connect to workflow etc

annotation.shortDefinition: The person who generated the image
annotation.definition: The person who administered the collection of the image

annotation.shortDefinition: Imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior
annotation.definition: The name of the imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).
The name of the device / manufacturer of the device that was used to make the recording

annotation.shortDefinition: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video)
annotation.definition: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video)

annotation.shortDefinition: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)
annotation.definition: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)

The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single iamge, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this must have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required
The length of the recording in seconds - for audio and video
The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file
annotation.comment: Recommended content types: image/jpeg, image/png, image/tiff, video/mpeg, audio/mp4, application/dicom. Application/dicom can contain the transfer syntax as a parameter

invariant.human: Frames can only be used for a photo
Width can only be used for a photo or video
Height can only be used for a photo or video
Length can only be used for an audio or a video

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: subject
search.description: Who/What this Media is a record of

search.name: subtype
search.description: The type of acquisition equipment/process

search.name: view
search.description: Imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior

search.name: date
search.description: When the media was taken/recorded

search.name: type
search.description: photo | audio | video

search.name: identifier
search.description: Identifier(s) for the image

search.name: operator
search.description: The person who generated the image

annotations.definition: This is primarily for identification and definition of Medication, but also covers ingredients and packaging
A nested type in Medication: A set of components that go to make up the described item.

annotation.definition: The product that is in the package
The amount of the product that is in the package

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: Specifies Ingredient / Product / Package

annotation.definition: The kind of container that this package comes as
A set of components that go to make up the described item.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: The ingredients of the medication

annotation.definition: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication

annotation.definition: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. E.g. 250 mg per tablet
annotation.v2Mapping: if substance: RXC-3-Component Amount & RXC-4-Component Units if medication: RXO-2-Requested Give Amount - Minimum & RXO-4-Requested Give Units / RXO-3-Requested Give Amount - Maximum & RXO-4-Requested Give Units / RXO-11-Requested Dispense Amount & RXO-12-Requested Dispense Units / RXE-3-Give Amount - Minimum & RXE-5-Give Units / RXE-4-Give Amount - Maximum & RXE-5-Give Units / RXE-10-Dispense Amount & RXE-10-Dispense Units

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: If is a product

annotation.definition: Describes the form of the item. Powder; tables; carton

annotation.definition: The ingredients of the medication
annotation.comment: The ingredients need not be a complete list; usually only active ingredients are listed

code.definition: The medication is a product
The medication is a package - a contained group of one of more products

annotation.definition: References to codes for this medication in standard medication terminologies, drug dictionaries, etc

annotation.definition: Set to true if the item is attributable to a specific manufacturer (even if we don't know who that is)

annotations.shortDefinition: Administration of medication to a patient
annotations.definition:
Describes the event of a patient being given a dose of a medication. This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a long running infusion.
Related resources tie this event to the authorizing prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care practitioner
A nested type in MedicationAdministration: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient

annotation.definition: The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013"
A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject.

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV.
Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of themedication given at one administration event. Use this value when the administration is essentially an instantaneous event such as a swallowing a tablet or giving an injection.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-6-Administered Amount / RXA-7.1-Administered Units.code / RXA-7.3-Administered Units.name of coding system (uri<->code system mapping required)
annotation.todo: Expand notes on relationship between quantity and rate.

annotation.shortDefinition: Dose quantity per unit of time
annotation.definition: Identifies the speed with which the medication is introduced into the patient. Typically the rate for an infusion e.g. 200ml in 2 hours. May also expressed as a rate per unit of time such as 100ml per hour - the duration is then not specified, or is specified in the quantity.
annotation.todo: explain what happens if rate is not continuous

annotation.shortDefinition: Total dose that should be consumed per unit of time
annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that my be administered to a subject over the period of time. E.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationStatus
binding.definition: A set of codes indicating the current status of a MedicationAdministration

code.definition: The administration has started but has not yet completed.
Actions implied by the administration have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "held".
All actions that are implied by the administration have occured.
The administration was entered in error and therefore nullified.
Actions implied by the administration have been permanently halted, before all of them occured.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationNegationReason
binding.definition: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration is negated.

annotation.definition: External identifier - FHIR will generate its own internal IDs (probably URLs) which do not need to be explicitly managed by the resource. The identifier here is one that would be used by another non-FHIR system - for example an automated medication pump would provide a record each time it operated; an administration while the patient was off the ward might be made with a different system and entered after the event. Particularly important if these records have to be updated.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-25-Administered Barcode Identifier? (V2 def'n of RXA-25 refers to the 'give' occurrence; appears not to discuss 'administer' cardinality which would seem to be 0..*)

annotation.shortDefinition: Status of the administration - active | paused | completed | nullified
annotation.definition: Will generally be set to show that the administration has been completed. For some long running administrations such as infusions it is possible for an administration to be started but not completed or it may be paused while some other process is under way.
A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication was given.
This is the individual who is responsible for giving the medication to the patient.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-10-Administering Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='AP' (RXA-10 is deprecated)

annotation.definition: An link to a resource that identifies the particular occurrence of contact between patient and health care provider.
A link to a resource that provides the original request, instruction and authority to perform the administration.
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-3-Filler Order Number / ORC-2-Placer Order Number

annotation.shortDefinition: True if asserting medication was not given
annotation.definition: Set this to true if the record is saying that the medication was NOT administered.

A code indicating why the administration has been negated.
Use only if isNegated is set to TRUE
An interval of time during which the administration takes place. For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the lower and upper values of the interval will be the same.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-3-Date/Time Start of Administration / RXA-4-Date/Time End of Administration

annotation.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
An identifier or a link to a resource that identifies a device used in administering the medication to the patient.

annotation.shortDefinition: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer
annotation.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient

annotations.shortDefinition: Dispensing a medication to a named patient
annotations.definition: Dispensing a medication to a named patient. This includes a description of the supply provided and the instructions for administering the medication.
A nested type in MedicationDispense: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient

annotation.definition: Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded.
annotation.rimMapping: RXE-7.2-Provider's Administration Instructions.text / RXO-7.2-Provider's Administration Instructions.text / TQ1-10-Condition Text / TQ1-11-Text Instruction ?

annotation.definition: The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013"
A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject.

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV.
Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of the therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-23-Give Rate Amount / RXE-24.1-Give Rate Units.code / RXE-24.3-Give Rate Units.name of coding system

annotation.shortDefinition: Dose quantity per unit of time
annotation.definition: Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours.

annotation.shortDefinition: Total dose that should be consumed per unit of time
annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that my be administered to a subject over the period of time. E.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationDispense: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.

annotation.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.
annotation.committeeNotes: No substitution made or expected Subtitution made but not expected Substitution expected but not made Substitution made and expected

annotation.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution of (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

annotation.shortDefinition: Who is responsible for the substitution
annotation.definition: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution
annotation.committeeNotes: Who is this handled? Elsewhere attribution is handled by FHIR

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationDispense: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.

annotation.definition: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility. This is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.
A code specifying the state of the dispense event.
annotation.committeeNotes:
Active - processed but not pickup Completed - process and pickup Aborted - process and put back in stock
This is not related to partialFill whioch is really a partialFulfillment of the order

annotation.definition: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.
The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

annotation.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
The time the dispense event occurred.
annotation.committeeNotes: This is time of dispense (preparation). The time of supply to the patient is a separate attribute.

annotation.definition: The time the dispense event occurred.
annotation.committeeNotes: The time of supply to the patient (pickup/handover in community or supply in inpatient).

annotation.definition: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-13-Dispense-to Location; RXD-30-Dispense to Pharmacy; RXD-31-Dispense to Pharmacy Address (V2 (in definition of RXD-13, RXD-30 and RXD-31) directs use of the PRT segment but there doesn't appear to be a standard code in Table 0912 suitable for PRT-4-Participation)
annotation.committeeNotes:
for inpatient setting this is core, but this may not be core for community setting. Also core for internet pharmacy. Core for radioactive materials
Will service delivery location be defined by another group?

annotation.definition: Identifies the person who picked up the medication.
annotation.committeeNotes: This is in the core because Controlled Drugs must be signed for and the recievers identiy must be recorded.

annotation.shortDefinition: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer
annotation.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient
annotation.committeeNotes: The RMIM has priority code on the act relationship. How do we handle this?

binding.description: Describes the lifecycle of the dispense.

code.definition: The dispense has started but has not yet completed.
Actions implied by the administration have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "held".
All actions that are implied by the dispense have occured.
The dispense was entered in error and therefore nullified.
Actions implied by the dispense have been permanently halted, before all of them occured.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseType

annotation.definition: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-25-Administered Barcode Identifier? (no unique dispense ID provided in RXD segment; V2 def'n of RXA-25 refers to the 'give' occurrence; appears not to discuss 'dispense' cardinality which would seem to be 0..*)

annotation.definition: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.
annotation.v2Mapping: (Not clear whether or how V2 provides for a snapshot of dispense status)
annotation.committeeNotes:
Active - processed but not pickup Completed - process and pickup Aborted - process and put back in stock
This is not related to partialFill whioch is really a partialFulfillment of the order

annotation.definition: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.
The individual reponsible for dispensing the medication
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-10-Dispensing Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='DP' (RXD-10 is deprecated)

annotation.shortDefinition: Medication order that authorises the dispense
annotation.definition: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-3-Filler Order Number / ORC-2-Placer Order Number

annotation.definition: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.
annotation.committeeNotes: How do we handle the sequence number when there are multiple instances of this event?

annotation.shortDefinition: Deals with substitution of one medicine for another
annotation.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.

annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that my be administered to a subject over the period of time. E.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationPrescription: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen, and in others it does not matter. This block explains the prescribers intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

annotation.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug should be dispensed from what was prescribed.
Indicates the reason for the substitution why substitution must or must not be performed.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationPrescription: Deals with details of the dispense part of the order

annotation.definition: Identifies the medication that is to be dispensed. This may be a more specifically defined than the medicationPrescription.medication . This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-2-Give Code / RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXD-2-Dispense/Give Code

annotation.definition: Design Comments: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription) It reflects the prescriber perspective for the validity of the prescription. Dispenses must not be made against the prescription outside of this period. The lower-bound of the Dispensing Window signifies the earliest date that the prescription can be filled for the first time. If an upper-bound is not specified then the Prescription is open-ended or will default to a stale-date based on regulations. Rationale: Indicates when the Prescription becomes valid, and when it ceases to be a dispensable Prescription.
annotation.todo: Check v2 mapping

annotation.definition: An integer indicating the number of repeats of the Dispense. UsageNotes: For example, the number of times the prescribed quantity is to be supplied including the initial standard fill.
The amount that is to be dispensed.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

annotation.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last. In some situations, this attribute may be used instead of quantity to identify the amount supplied by how long it is expected to last, rather than the physical quantity issued. E.g. 90 days supply of medication (based on an ordered dosage) When possible, it is always better to specify quantity, as this tends to be more precise. expectedSupplyDuration will always be an estimate that can be influenced by external factors.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationMethod
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the technique by which the medicine is administered

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationSite
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the site location the medicine enters into or onto the body

binding.name: MedicationPrescriptionStatus
binding.definition: A code specifying the state of the prescribing event. Describes the lifecycle of the prescription.

code.definition: The prescription is 'actionable', but not all actions that are implied by it have occured yet.
Actions implied by the prescription have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "held".
All actions that are implied by the prescription have occured (this will rarely be made explicit).
The prescription was entered in error and therefore nullified.
Actions implied by the prescription have been permanently halted, before all of them occured.
The prescription was replaced by a newer one, which encompasses all the information in the previous one.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionType
binding.definition: A coded concept describing whether a different medicinal product may be dispensed other than the product as specified exactly in the prescription

binding.name: RouteOfAdministration
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.

binding.name: MedicationPrescriptionReviewStatus
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the current status of any reviews planned or performed on the prescription

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionReason
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

annotation.definition: External identifier - one that would be used by another non-FHIR system - for example a re-imbursement system might issue its own id for each prescription that is created. annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-2-Placer Order Number / ORC-3-Filler Order Number

annotation.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was written

annotation.definition: A code specifying the state of the order. Generally this will be active or completed state

annotation.definition: A link to a resource that identifies the particular occurrence of contact between patient and health care provider.

annotation.shortDefinition: Reason or indication for writing the prescription
annotation.definition: Can be the reason or the indication for writing the prescription.
