A nested type in MedicationStatement: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient

annotation.definition: The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013"
A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject.

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV.
Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of the therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-6-Administered Amount / RXA-7.1-Administered Units.code / RXA-7.3-Administered Units.name of coding system

annotation.shortDefinition: Dose quantity per unit of time
annotation.definition: Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours.

annotation.shortDefinition: Total dose that should be consumed per unit of time
annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that my be administered to a subject over the period of time. E.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

External identifier - FHIR will generate its own internal IDs (probably URLs) which do not need to be explicitly managed by the resource. The identifier here is one that would be used by another non-FHIR system - for example an automated medication pump would provide a record each time it operated; an administration while the patient was off the ward might be made with a different system and entered after the event. Particularly important if these records have to be updated.
A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication was given.

annotation.shortDefinition: True if asserting medication was not given
annotation.definition: Set this to true if the record is saying that the medication was NOT administered.

annotation.shortDefinition: True if asserting medication was not given
annotation.definition:
A code indicating why the administration has been negated.
Use only if isNegated is set to TRUE
An interval of time during which the administration takes place. For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the lower and upper values of the interval will be the same.

annotation.comment: SubstanceAdministration->device->Access OR SubstanceAdministration->device->AssignedDevice

annotations.shortDefinition: A message that contains resources
annotations.definition: A transmission requesting action on a bundle of one or more resources or a response to such a request
annotations.requirements: Many implementations are not prepared to use REST and need a message based infrastructure

annotations.definition: A nested type in Message: The destination application which the message is intended for

annotation.definition: Human readable name for the source system
annotation.requirements: May be used for routing of response and/or to support audit

annotation.shortDefinition: Particular delivery destination within the destination
annotation.definition: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.
annotation.requirements: Supports multi-hop routing

annotation.definition: Indicates where the message should be routed to.
annotation.comment: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses
annotation.requirements: Identifies where to route the message
annotation.v2Mapping: MSH-25-receiving network address (or MSH-6-receiving facility by implication)

annotations.definition: A nested type in Message: The source application from which this message originated

annotation.definition: Human readable name for the target system
annotation.requirements: May be used to support audit

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of software running the system
annotation.definition: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.
annotation.requirements: Supports audit and possibly interface engine behavior

annotation.definition: Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.
annotation.requirements: Supports audit and possibly interface engine behavior
annotation.v2Mapping: SFT-2-software certified version or release number
annotation.committeeNotes: Version is not captured as a distinct property in v3

annotation.definition: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.
annotation.requirements: Allows escalation of technical issues.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./entity[determinerCode="INST" and classCode="DEV"]/scopesRole[normalRole() and classCode="CON" and layer[classCode="PSN"]/telecom[isNormalDatatype()])
annotation.committeeNotes: Should actually have a code for the role in the v3 mapping to indicate that the contact is for "problems"

annotation.shortDefinition: Actual message source address or id
annotation.definition: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.
annotation.comment: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses
annotation.requirements: Identifies where to send responses, may influence security permissions

annotations.definition: A nested type in Message: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

annotation.definition: The id of the message that this a response to
annotation.requirements: Allows receiver to know what message is being responded to

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of response to the message
annotation.definition: Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not
annotation.comment: This is a generic response to the request Message. Specific data for the response will be found in Message.data
annotation.requirements: Allows the sender of the acknowledge message to know if the request was successful or if action is needed.

annotation.definition: Full details of any issues found in the message
annotation.comment: This must be contained in the bundle. If any of the issues are errors, the response code must be an error
annotation.requirements: Allows the sender of the message to determine what the specific issues are

binding.name: EventReason
binding.definition: The reason for an event occurring

binding.name: ResponseCode
binding.definition: The kind of response to a message

code.definition: The message was accepted and processed without error

Some internal unexpected error occurred - wait and try again. Note - this is usually used for things like database unavailable, which may be expected to resolve, though human intervention may be required
The message was rejected because of some content in it. There is no point in re-sending without change. The response narrative must describe what the issue is.

The message was rejected because of some event-specific business rules, and it may be possible to modify the request and re-submit (as a different request). The response must include an Issue report that describes what problem is
A middleware agent was unable to deliver the message to its intended destination

annotation.definition: The identifier of this message
annotation.comment: This must be unique within the scope of this stream of messages

annotation.shortDefinition: Time that the message was sent
annotation.definition: The time that the message was sent
annotation.requirements: Allows limited detection of out-of-order and delayed transmission. Also supports audit.

annotation.shortDefinition: Code for the event his message represents
annotation.definition: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with the event definition in the FHIR specification
annotation.requirements: Drives the behavior associated with this message
annotation.todo: Consider changing to Coding to support profile-defined events

annotation.shortDefinition: If this is a reply to prior message
annotation.definition: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.
The source application from which this message originated
annotation.requirements: Allows replies, supports audit.

annotation.definition: The destination application which the message is intended for
annotation.requirements: Indicates where message is to be sent to for routing purposes. Allows verification of "am I the intended recipient"

annotation.shortDefinition: The source of the data entry
annotation.definition: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this Message. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the Message. Can provide other enterers in extensions
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response
annotation.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements and possibly for authorization.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="ENT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])
annotation.v2Mapping: EVN-5-operator ID / ORC-10-entered by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='EP' / ROL where ROL.3 is EP or ORC.10

annotation.definition: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided the described event should happen. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the Message. Can provide other authors in extensions
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response
annotation.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements and possibly for authorization.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-19-action by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='AUT' / ROL where ROL.3 is IP or ORC.12

annotation.definition: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.
annotation.requirements: Allows routing beyond just to the application level
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the Message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response
annotation.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements and possibly for authorization.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode="PSN" and determinerCode="INST"] or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/scoper[isNormalEntity() and classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST"])
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-12-ordering provider / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / PRT-8-Participation Organization:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / ROL where ROL.3 is RO or ORC.11

annotation.definition: The effective time - the real world time of the event that the message represents. Usually this is just a starting time, but some message events also have an end time (do x for period y)
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response
annotation.requirements: Need to know for understanding the content of the message, may govern receiver's behavior.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/effectiveTime[isNormalDatatype() and type="IVL_TS"])
annotation.v2Mapping: EVN.3 or EVN.6 or ORC.15 / TQ1-7-start date/time + TQ1-8-end date/time
annotation.todo: Grahame thinks this is not 80/20. Also, that it really should be domain modeled, not tucked away here

annotation.definition: The cause of the event - a reason for the event that is a focus of this message occurred
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track why resources are being changed and report in the audit log / history of the resource. May affect authorization.
annotation.v2Mapping: EVN.4 / ORC.16 / OBR-31-reason for study / BPO-13-BP indication for use / RXO-20-indication / RXE-27-give indication / RXD-21-indication / RXG-22-indication / RXA-19-indication

annotation.shortDefinition: The actual content of the message
annotation.definition: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event.
annotation.comment: The data is defined where the transaction type is defined. The transaction data is always included in the bundle that is the full message. Only the root resource is specified. The tree of referenced resources conveyed in the atom feed is determined by navigating the tree and consulting the "bundled" property of the profile, not by listing all resources here. Multiple repetitions are provided for merges and other situations with multiple focal targets
annotation.requirements: Every message event is about actual data, a single resource, that is identified in the definition of the event, and perhaps some or all linked resources
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/outboundRelationship[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalActRelatoinship]/target)

annotations.shortDefinition: Simple observations
annotations.definition: Simple assertions and measurements made about a patient, device or other subject
annotations.comment: Used for simple observations such as device measures, laboratory atomic results, vital signs, height, weight, smoking status, comments, etc. Other resources are used to descrive aggregate collections of observations such as Lab reports, etc
annotations.requirements: Observations are a key aspect of healthcare. This resource is used to capture those that do not require more sophisticated mechanisms.
annotations.rimMapping: Observation[isNormalAct() and subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and domainMember("SimpleObservationType", code)]

annotations.definition: A nested type in Observation: Component observation

annotation.definition: Identifies what type of sub-observation was performed
annotation.requirements: Knowing what kind of observation is being made is essential to understanding the observation.

annotation.definition: The information determined as a result of making the sub-observation
annotation.comment: The datatype for this element should be determined by Observation.name
annotation.requirements: A result with no value isn't much use. (Though an exceptional value such as 'unknown' may still be useful.)
annotation.committeeNotes: Do we need the full set of data types for sub-observations? And can we get away without status, reliability, etc.?

annotations.definition: A nested type in Observation: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range

annotation.definition: Code for the meaning of the reference range
annotation.comment: This is only usually populated if there is more than one range
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to say what kind of reference range this is - normal, recommended, therapeutic, or perhaps what state this reference range applies to (i.e. age, hormonal cycles, etc.)

annotation.definition: Actual value of the reference range. May be a quantity (<20mg/L), an range (10-20 umol/L), or some text
annotation.comment: Text reference ranges are typically used in endocrinology, or for legacy data with string reference ranges
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to report numerical or text reference ranges, and handle legacy data

binding.name: ObservationMethod
binding.definition: Methods for simple observations

binding.name: ObservationType
binding.description: LOINC codes filtered to exclude panel codes
binding.definition: Codes identifying types of simple observations

binding.name: ObservationRangeMeaning
binding.definition: Code for the meaning of a reference range

binding.name: ObservationReliability
binding.definition: Codes that provide reliability information about an observation

code.definition: The result has no reliability concerns
An early estimate of value; measurement is still occurring
An early estimate of value; processing is still occurring
The observation value should be treated with care
The result has been generated while calibration is occurring
The observation could not be completed because of an error
No observation value was available

binding.name: ObservationInterpretation
binding.definition: Codes identifying interpretations of observations

annotation.definition: Identifies what type of observation was performed
annotation.requirements: Knowing what kind of observation is being made is essential to understanding the observation.

annotation.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation
annotation.comment: The datatype for this element should be determined by Observation.name
annotation.requirements: A result with no value isn't much use. (Though an exceptional value such as 'unknown' may still be useful.)

annotation.definition: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.
annotation.requirements: For some results, particularly numeric results, an interpretation is necessary to fully understand the significance of a result.

annotation.definition: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable. values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to provide free text additional information
annotation.v2Mapping: NTE.3 (partner NTE to OBX, or sometimes another (child?) OBX)

annotation.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time".
annotation.comment: At least a date should be present unless this observation is a historical report
annotation.requirements: Knowing when an observation was deemed true is important to its relevance as well as determining trends

annotation.definition: Date/Time this was made available
annotation.comment: Updated when the result is updated

annotation.definition: The status of the result value
annotation.requirements: Need to track the status of individual results - some results are finalised before the whole report is finalised

annotation.definition: An estimate of the degree to which quality issues have impacted on the value reported
annotation.comment: Note that in most contexts, unreliable results are not recorded, deleted, or otherwise excluded, but this is not always done or possible. Interpreters of a result, whether human or machine, must always either be aware of the status, or prevented from seeing the observation if the reliability is not "ok"
annotation.requirements: Not all results are completely reliable, and some are still reported anyway.

annotation.definition: Indicates where on the subject's body the observation was made.
annotation.comment: Only used if not implicit in code found in Observation.name
annotation.requirements: Knowing where observation is made is important for tracking if multiple sites are possible.
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation
annotation.comment: Only used if not implicit in code for SimpleObservation.result.type
annotation.requirements: In some cases, method can impact results and is thus for determing whether results can be compared or determining significance of results
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: A unique identifier for the simple observation
annotation.requirements: Allows observations to be distinguished and referenced

annotation.definition: The thing the observation is being made about
annotation.comment: The only circumstance in which the subject can be missing is when the observation is made by a device that does not know the patient. In this case, the observation must be matched to a patient through some context/channel matching technique, and at this point, the observation should be updated
annotation.requirements: Observations have no value if you don't know who or what they're about.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation()]/role or ./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation()]/role/entity)

annotation.definition: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true"
annotation.comment: This would only be "Device" if the device is responsible for the measurement, not to capture the device used by a human to make the measurement. (The latter could be captured as an extension.)
annotation.requirements: May give a degree of confidence in the observation and also indicates where follow-up questions should be directed.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="PRF" and isNormalParticipation()]/role or ./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="PRF" and isNormalParticipation()]/role/entity]
annotation.v2Mapping: OBX.15 / (Practitioner) OBX-16-responsible observer , PRT-5-participation person:PRT-4-participation='RO' / (Device) OBX-18-equipment instance identifier , PRT-10-participation device:PRT-4-participation='EQUIP' / (Organization) OBX-23-performing organization name, PRT-8-participation organization:PRT-4-participation='PO'

annotation.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range
annotation.comment: Most results only have one reference range, might be generic or be specific to the patient's age, gender, weight and other factors. When these things are not known, multiple reference ranges may be provided
annotation.requirements: Knowing what values are considered "normal" can help evaluate the significance of a particular result. Need to be able to provide multiple reference ranges for different contexts

annotation.definition: Component observation
annotation.comment: It would be usual to either have a value or components with values, but both may be used, such as for APGAR scores

annotation.comment: This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not confuse hints and warnings with errors
annotation.requirements: Indicates how relevant the issue is to the overall success of the action.
annotation.rimMapping: ./typeCode[parent::AcknowledgmentDetail] or unique(./inboundRelationship[parent::Observation and typeCode='SUBJ' and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[classCode="OBS" and moodCode="EVN" and implies(code, ActCode#SEV and isNormalAct())/value[xsi:type="CD"]

annotation.definition: A code indicating the type of error, warning or information message.
annotation.comment: Codes should only be defined at a level of granularity that reasonably allows distinct actions to be taken by the receiving system. If the response behavior of all systems is the same for two codes, the codes might as well be merged. The human-meaningful content of the issue is conveyed in .text.
annotation.requirements: Expresses the issue in a computer-friendly way, allowing the requesting system to behave differently based on the type of issue.
annotation.todo: Do we want to define an initial set of codes, or should we leave all of this to profiles?

annotation.definition: Additional description of the issue
annotation.comment: typically this field is used to provide details human readable information about the error

annotation.shortDefinition: XPath of element(s) related to issue
annotation.definition: A simple XPath limited to element names, repetition indicators and the default child access that identifies one of the elements in the resource that caused this issue to be raised.
annotation.comment: The root of the XPath is the resource or bundle that generated OperationOutcome. Each XPath must resolve to a single node. The XPath syntax is used whether the referenced instance is expressed in XML or JSON.
annotation.requirements: Allows systems to highlight or otherwise guide users to elements implicated in issues to allow them to be fixed more easily.

binding.name: IssueType
binding.definition: A coded expression of the type of issue

code.definition: Content invalid against Specification or Profile
content structural issue
required element missing
element value invalid
schematron rule
authorization/permissions issue
the client needs to initiate the authentication process ()
user/system not able to be authenticated
user session expired
user rights failure
processing issues
resource not supported
duplicate resource
reference not found
existing content too long
code could not be understood
extension not recognised
operation denied to protect server resources
content failed to pass some business rule
content could not be accepted because of an edit conflict (i.e. version aware updates)
transient processing issues
resource/record locking failure
persistent store unavailable
unexpected internal error
internal timeout
The system is not prepared to handle this request due to load management

binding.name: IssueSeverity
binding.definition: How the issue affects the success of the action

code.definition: The issue caused the action to fail, and no further checking could be performed
The issue is sufficiently important to cause the action to fail
The issue is not important enough to cause the action to fail, but may cause it to be performed suboptimally or in a way that is not as desired
The issue has no relation to the degree of success of the action

annotation.shortDefinition: A single issue associated with the action
annotation.definition: An error, warning or information message that results from a system action

annotations.shortDefinition: A grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose
annotations.definition: A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, etc
A nested type in Organization: Contact for the organization for a certain purpose

annotation.definition: Indicates a purpose for which the contact can be reached
annotation.requirements: Need to distinguish between multiple contact persons.

annotation.shortDefinition: A name associated with the contact
annotation.definition: A name associated with the contact
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track the person by name.

annotation.shortDefinition: Contact details (telephone, email, etc) for a contact
annotation.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the party may be contacted.
annotation.requirements: People have (primary) ways to contact them in some way such as phone, email.

annotation.shortDefinition: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact
annotation.definition: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact
annotation.requirements: May need to keep track of a contact party's address for contacting, billing or reporting requirements

annotation.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
annotation.requirements: Needed to address the person correctly

binding.name: OrganizationType
binding.definition: Used to categorize the organization

binding.name: ContactPartyType
binding.definition: The purpose for which you would contact a contact party

annotation.definition: Identifier for the organization that is used to identify the organization across multiple disparate systems
annotation.requirements: Organizations are known by a variety of ids. Some institutions maintain several, and most collect identifiers for exchange with other organizations concerning the organization.
annotation.v2Mapping: XON.10 Organization Identifier / XON.3 ID Number

annotation.definition: A name associated with the organization
annotation.requirements: Need to use the name as the label of the organization.
annotation.committeeNotes: If you need multiple names to cater for acronyms and "trading under" names, use an extension "alias" instead

annotation.definition: The kind of organization that this is
annotation.comment: Organizations can be corporations, wards, sections, clinical teams, government departments, etc. Note that code is generally a classifier of the type of organization; in many applications, codes are used to identity a particular organization (say, ward) as opposed to another of the same type - these are identifiers, not codes
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track the kind of organization that this is - different organization types have different uses

annotation.shortDefinition: A contact detail for the organization
annotation.definition: A contact detail for the organization
annotation.comment: The use code home is not to be used. Note that these contacts are not the contact details of people who are employed by or represent the organization, but official contacts for the organization itself
annotation.requirements: Human contact for the organization

annotation.definition: An address for the organization
annotation.comment: Organization may have multiple addresses with different uses or applicable periods. The use code home is not to be used
annotation.requirements: May need to keep track of the organizations addresses for contacting, billing or reporting requirements
annotation.v2Mapping: No authoritative equivalent in V2.x; some V2.x segments such as OBX might provide a serialized instance value

annotation.shortDefinition: The organization of which this organization forms a part
annotation.definition: The organization of which this organization forms a part
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track the hierarchy of organizations within an organization

annotation.definition: Contact for the organization for a certain purpose
annotation.requirements: Need to keep track of assigned contact points within bigger organization

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether the organization's record is still in active use
annotation.definition: Whether the organization's record is still in active use
annotation.comment: Default is true.
annotation.requirements: Need a flag to indicate a record is no longer to be used and should generally be hidden for the user in the UI.
annotation.committeeNotes: Lloyd(?): This isn't data we record about an organization but is data about this organization's record. I would argue about including this metadata here. It also implies effects on functionality, like not showing up in queries anymore, which cannot be guaranteed. All in all, this belongs to record infrastructure, not data

invariant.human: The organization must at least have a name or and id, and possibly more

search.name: phonetic
search.description: A portion of the Organization's name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

search.name: partof
search.description: Search all organizations that are part of the given organization

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: name
search.description: A portion of the Organization's name

search.name: active
search.description: Whether the organization's record is active

search.name: type
search.description: A code for the type of organization

search.name: identifier
search.description: Any identifier for the organization (not the accreditation issuer's identifier)

annotations.shortDefinition: Information about a person or animal receiving health care services
annotations.definition: Demographics and other administrative information about a person or animal receiving care or other health-related services
annotations.requirements: Tracking patient is the center of the healthcare process

annotations.definition: A nested type in Patient: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient

annotation.definition: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the contactperson
annotation.requirements: Used to determine which contactperson is most relevant approach, depending on circumstances

annotation.shortDefinition: A name associated with the person
annotation.definition: A name associated with the person
annotation.requirements: Contact persons need to be identified by name, but it is uncommon to need details about multiple other names for that person

annotation.shortDefinition: A contact detail for the person
annotation.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
annotation.comment: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently, and also to help with identification
annotation.requirements: People have (primary) ways to contact them in some way such as phone, email.

annotation.definition: Address for the contact person
annotation.requirements: Need to keep track where the contact person can be contacted per postal mail or visited

annotation.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
annotation.requirements: Needed to address the person correctly

annotation.shortDefinition: Organization that is associated with the contact
annotation.definition: Organization on behalf of which the contact is acting or for which the contact is working.
annotation.requirements: For guardians or business related contacts, the organization is relevant

annotations.definition: A nested type in Patient: This element has a value if the patient is an animal

annotation.definition: Identifies the high level categorization of the kind of animal
annotation.comment: If the patient is non-human, at least a species must be specified
annotation.requirements: Need to know what kind of animal

annotation.definition: Identifies the detailed categorization of the kind of animal.
annotation.requirements: May need to know the specific kind within the species

annotation.definition: Indicates the current state of the animal's reproductive organs
annotation.requirements: Gender status can affect housing and animal behavior

binding.name: AnimalGenderStatus
binding.definition: The state of the animal's reproductive organs

binding.name: AnimalBreed
binding.definition: The breed of an animal

binding.name: AnimalSpecies
binding.definition: The species of an animal

binding.name: ContactRelationship
binding.definition: The nature of the relationship between a patient and a contactperson for that patient

annotation.shortDefinition: An identifier for the person as this patient
annotation.definition: An identifier that applies to this person as a patient
annotation.requirements: Patients are almost always assigned specific numerical identifiers

annotation.shortDefinition: A name associated with the patient
annotation.definition: A name associated with the individual.
annotation.comment: Person may have multiple names with different uses or applicable periods.For animals, the name is a "HumanName" in the sense that is assigned and used by humans and has the same patterns
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track the person by multiple names. Examples are your official name and a partner name.

annotation.shortDefinition: A contact detail for the individual
annotation.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.
annotation.comment: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently and also to help with identification. The address may not go directly to the individual, but may reach another party that is able to proxy for the patient (i.e. home phone, or pet owner's phone)
annotation.requirements: People have (primary) ways to contact them in some way such as phone, email.

annotation.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
annotation.comment: The gender may not match the biological sex as determined by genetics, or the individual's preferred identification. Note that for both humans and particularly animals, there are other legitimate possibilities than M and F, though the vast majority of systems and contexts only support M and F
annotation.requirements: Needed for identification of the individual, in combination with (at least) name and birth date. Gender of individual drives many clinical processes.
annotation.committeeNotes: 'gender' is still the administrative gender, but this is reflected in its description rather than its name.

annotation.shortDefinition: The date and time of birth for the individual
annotation.definition: The date and time of birth for the individual
annotation.comment: At least an estimated year should be provided as a guess if the real dob is unknown
annotation.requirements: Age of the individual drives many clinical processes. Next to the common use case of capturing someone birth date, also in some common cases time is registered.
annotation.committeeNotes: renamed from dob, because the abbreviation is not obvious to non-English speakers

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not
annotation.definition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not
annotation.comment: If there's no value in the instance it means there is no statement on whether or not the individual is deceased. Most systems will interpret the absence of a value as a sign of the person being alive.
annotation.requirements: The fact that a patient is deceased influences the clinical process. Also, in human communication and relation management it is necessary to know whether the person is alive.

annotation.definition: Addresses for the individual
annotation.comment: Person may have multiple addresses with different uses or applicable periods
annotation.requirements: May need to keep track of persons addresses for contacting, billing or reporting requirements and also to help with identification

annotation.definition: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status.
annotation.requirements: Most, if not all systems capture it.

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether patient is part of a multiple birth
annotation.definition: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple or indicates the actual birth order.
annotation.requirements: For disambiguation of multiple-birth children, especially relevant where the care provider doesn't meet the patient, such as labs.

annotation.definition: Image of the person
annotation.requirements: Many EHR systems have the capability to capture an image of the patient. Fits with newer social media usage too.

annotation.shortDefinition: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient
annotation.definition: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient
annotation.comment: Contact covers all kinds of contact parties: family members, business contacts, guardians, caregivers. Not applicable to register pedigree and family ties beyond use of having contact.
annotation.requirements: Need to track people you can contact about the patient

annotation.shortDefinition: If this patient is an animal (non-human)
annotation.definition: This element has a value if the patient is an animal
annotation.comment: The animal element is labelled "Is Modifier" since patients may be non-human. Systems must either handle patient details appropriately (e.g. inform users patient is not human) or reject non-human patient records
annotation.requirements: Many clinical systems are extended to care for animal patients as well as human

annotation.shortDefinition: Languages which may be used to communicate with the patient
annotation.definition: Languages which may be used to communicate with the patient
annotation.comment: If no language is specified, this *implies* that the default local language is spoken. For animals, language is not a relevant field, and should be absent from the instance
annotation.requirements: If a patient does not speak the local language, interpreters may be required, so languages spoken is an important things to keep track of both for patient and other persons of interest
annotation.committeeNotes: Define proficiency and mode as extensions

annotation.definition: The provider for whom this is a patient record
annotation.requirements: Need to know who recognises this patient record

annotation.shortDefinition: Other patient resources linked to this resource
annotation.definition: A linked patient resource is a resource that concerns the same patient. Resources are linked after it is realized that at least one was created in error.
annotation.comment: More then two patient resources may be linked. Note that there is a special transaction for linking patient resources in the RESTful context, as resource linking consistency must be maintained
annotation.requirements: Due to the clerical errors associated with the difficulties of identifying humans consistently, duplicate patient records are frequently created in error

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether this patient's record is in active use
annotation.definition: Whether this patient record is in active use
annotation.comment: Default is true. If a record is inactive, and linked to an active record, then future patient/person/record updates should occur on the other patient
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to mark a patient record as not to be used because it was created in error
