search.description: a portion of either family or given name

search.name: telecom
search.description: the value in any kind of contact

search.name: gender
search.description: gender of the practitioner

search.name: identifier
search.description: A practitioner's Identifier

annotations.shortDefinition: An action that is performed on a patient
annotations.definition: An action that is performed on a patient. This can be a physical 'thing' like an operation, or less invasive like counselling or hypnotherapy
A nested type in Procedure: Procedures may be related to other items such as procedures or medciations. For example treating wound dehiscence following a previous procedure

annotation.definition: The nature of the relationship

annotation.shortDefinition: The related item - eg a procedure
annotation.definition: The related item - eg a procedure

annotations.definition: A nested type in Procedure: This is limited to 'real' people rather than equipment

annotation.definition: The practitioner who was involved in the procedure

annotation.shortDefinition: The role the person was in
annotation.definition: Eg surgeon, anaethetist, endoscopist

binding.name: ProcedureRelationshipType
binding.definition: the nature of the relationship

code.definition: This procedure had to be performed because of the related one
This procedure caused the related one to be performed

annotation.definition: The person on whom the procedure was performed
The specific procedure that is perfromed
Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - eg multiple punch biopsies of a lesion
The reason why the procedure was performed. This may be due to a Condition, may be coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text

annotation.shortDefinition: The people who performed the procedure
annotation.definition: This is limited to 'real' people rather than equipment

annotation.shortDefinition: The date the procedure was perfomed
annotation.definition: The dates over which the period was perfromed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more that one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

annotation.shortDefinition: The encounter during which the procedure was performed
annotation.definition: The encounter during which the procedure was performed
What was the outcome of the procedure - did it resolve reasons why the procedure was performed?

annotation.shortDefinition: Any report that results from the procedure
annotation.definition: This could be a histology result. There could potentially be multiple reports - eg if this was a procedure that made multiple biopsies

Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-operative period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, whicg typically will describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues

If the procedure required specific follow up - eg removal of sutures. The followup may be represented as a simple note, or potentially could be more complex in which case the CarePlan resource can be used

annotation.shortDefinition: A procedure that is related to this one
annotation.definition: Procedures may be related to other items such as procedures or medciations. For example treating wound dehiscence following a previous procedure
Any other notes about the procedure - eg the operative notes

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: subject
search.description: The identity of a patient to list procedures for

search.name: date
search.description: the date the procedure was perfromed on

search.name: type
search.description: type of procedure

annotations.shortDefinition: Resource Profile
annotations.definition: A Resource Profile - a statement of use of one or more FHIR Resources. It may include constraints on Resources and Data Types, Terminology Binding Statements and Extension Definitions
annotations.comment: Often called a clinical template

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: Definition of the content of the element to provide a more specific definition than that contained for the element in the base resource

annotation.definition: A concise definition that is shown in the concise XML format that summarizes profiles
annotation.comment: May change the term to provide language more appropriate to the context of the profile or to reflect slicing

annotation.definition: The definition must be consistent with the base definition, but convey the meaning of the element in the particular context of use of the resource
annotation.comment: It is easy for a different definition to change the meaning of an element and this can have nasty downstream consequences. Please be careful when providing definitions
annotation.requirements: To allow a user to clarify the usage of an element in a particular context

annotation.shortDefinition: Comments about the use of this element
annotation.definition: Comments about the use of the element, including notes about how to use the data properly, exceptions to proper use, etc.
annotation.comment: If it is possible to capture usage rules using invariants, that mechanism should be used in preference to this element

annotation.definition: Explains why this element is needed and why it's been constrained as it has
Identifies additional names by which this element might also be known
annotation.requirements: Allows for better easier recognition of the element by multiple communities, including international communities

annotation.definition: The minimum number of times this element must appear in the instance
The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the instance
The data type or resource that the value of this element is permitted to be
annotation.requirements: The Type of the element can be left blank, in which case the type is inherited from the resource. The type can only be listed in this field if it is an allowed option in the base resource

annotation.definition: Identifies the name of a slice defined elsewhere in the profile whose constraints should be applied to the current element
annotation.comment: If child components of this element are defined, they act as constraints on the referenced slice

annotation.definition: Specifies a value that must hold for this element in the instance
annotation.comment: To specify a fixed value for a complex data type, include the child elements for the type and specify fixed values for each property independently

annotation.definition: An example value for this element
annotation.comment: If the example value are fully populated, the publication tool can generate an instance automatically

annotation.definition: Indicates the shortest length that must be supported by conformant instances without truncation
annotation.comment: If not specified, there is no conformance expectation for length support
annotation.todo: Need to flesh this out more - leverage v2 approach

annotation.definition: A reference to an invariant that may make additional statements about the cardinality in the instance

annotation.shortDefinition: Condition that must evaluate to true
annotation.definition: Formal constraints such as co-occurrence and other constraints that can be computationally evaluated within the context of the instance
annotation.comment: Constraints should be declared on the "context" element - the lowest element in the hierarchy that is common to all nodes referenced by the constraint

annotation.shortDefinition: If the element must be usable
annotation.definition: If true, conformant resource authors must be capable of providing a value for the element and resource consumers must be capable of extracting and doing something useful with the data element. If false, the element may be ignored and not supported
annotation.comment: "Something useful" is context dependent. Key test is what would a reasonable observer expect of a system that explicitly claims to "support" this element
annotation.requirements: Allows a profile to set expectations for system capabilities beyond merely respecting cardinality constraints

annotation.shortDefinition: If the element must be understood
annotation.definition: If true, the element cannot be ignored by systems unless they recognize the element and a pre-determination has been made that it is not relevant to their particular system
annotation.comment: MustUnderstand elements can be ignored by applications that recognize the element and know that the element is not relevant in the context of their system.
annotation.requirements: Allows elements to be introduced into a specification that can't safely be ignored by applications that don't recognize them

annotation.shortDefinition: Reference to a binding (local or absolute)
annotation.definition: Identifies the set of codes that applies to this element if a data type supporting codes is used. The reference can be local - to a Profile.binding.name, or absolute, to a binding.name in another profile

annotation.shortDefinition: Map element to another set of definitions
annotation.definition: Identifies a concept from an external specification that roughly corresponds to this element
annotation.comment: Mappings are not necessarily specific enough for safe translation
annotation.requirements: Provides guidance to implementers familiar with or converting content from other specifications

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: Indicates that the element is sliced into a set of alternative definitions (there are multiple definitions on a single element in the base resource). The set of slices is any elements that come after this in the element sequence that have the same path, until a shorter path occurs (the shorter path terminates the set)

annotation.shortDefinition: Element that used to distinguish the slices
annotation.definition: Designates which child element is used to discriminate between the slices when processing an instance. The value of the child element in the instance must completely distinguish which slice the element in the resource matches based on the allowed values for that element in each of the slices

annotation.shortDefinition: If elements must be in same order as slices
annotation.definition: If the matching elements have to occur in the same order as defined in the profile
annotation.comment: Order should only be required when it is a pressing concern for presentation. Profile authors should consider making the order a feature of the rules about the narrative, not the rules about the data - requiring ordered data makes the profile much less re-usable

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether slice list is open or closed
annotation.definition: Whether additional slices are allowed or not. When the slices are ordered, profile authors can also say that additional slices are only allowed at the end
annotation.comment: Allowing additional elements makes for a much for flexible template - it's open for use in wider contexts, but also means that the content of the resource is not closed, and applications have to decide how to handle content not described by the profile

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: A constraint statement about what contents a resource or data type may have

annotation.shortDefinition: The Resource or Data Type being described
annotation.definition: The Resource or Data type being described
annotation.comment: Only complex types can be constrained, not primitive types such as string etc

annotation.shortDefinition: Name for this particular structure (reference target)
annotation.definition: The name of this resource constraint statement (to refer to it from other resource constraints - from Profile.structure.element.definition.type.profile)
annotation.comment: This field is the target for a resource.profile

annotation.shortDefinition: This definition is published (i.e. for validation)
annotation.definition: This definition of a profile on a structure is published as a formal statement. Some structural definitions might be defined purely for internal use within the profile, and not intended to be used outside that context
annotation.comment: If there is more than one published structure for each type, and the URL reference to the profile doesn't specify which named structure to use (using a URL fragment, e.g. #...) then which profile to use is indeterminate, and an error should be raised

annotation.shortDefinition: Human summary: why describe this resource?
annotation.definition: Human summary: why describe this resource?

annotation.shortDefinition: Definition of elements in the resource (if no profile)
annotation.definition: Captures constraints on each element within the resource

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: Defines a linkage between a vocabulary binding name used in the profile (or expected to be used in profile importing this one) and a value set or code list

annotation.definition: The name to be associated with this set of codes
annotation.comment: Must be unique within the profile. If the same name as an imported profile, will override the imported binding (and must be a proper constraint on the imported binding)

annotation.definition: If true, then conformant systems may use additional codes or (where the data type permits) text alone to convey concepts not covered by the set of codes identified in the binding. If false, then conformant systems are constrained to the provided codes alone
annotation.comment: When the binding use used for elements with a type of "code" (rather than Coding or CodableConcept), the binding is treated as non-extensible regardless of the value of this property

annotation.definition: Indicates the degree of conformance expectations associated with this binding
Describes the intended use of this particular set of codes
Points to the value set or external definition that identifies the set of codes to be used
annotation.comment: For value sets,the referenceResource, the display can contain the value set description. The reference may be version-specific or not

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: The data type or resource that the value of this element is permitted to be

annotation.definition: Data type or Resource

Identifies a profile that must hold for resources or datatypes referenced as the type of this element. Can be a local reference - to another structure in this profile, or a reference to a structure in another profile
annotation.comment: The reference might be a simple name in the form #[name], which is a reference to another named constraint in a resource - where the resource contains more than one constraint, or a URL which is a reference to a resource Profile

annotation.shortDefinition: If code is a Resource, is it in the bundle?
annotation.definition: Whether the Resource that is the value for this element is included in the bundle, if the profile is specifying a bundle
annotation.comment: If context includes bundling

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: Identifies a concept from an external specification that roughly corresponds to this element

annotation.shortDefinition: Which mapping this is (v2, CDA, openEHR, etc.)
annotation.definition: The name of the specification is mapping is being expressed to
Expresses what part of the target specification corresponds to this element
annotation.comment: For most mappings, the syntax is undefined. Syntax will be provided for mappings to the RIM. Multiple mappings may be possible and may include constraints on other resource elements that identify when a particular mapping applies

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: Formal constraints such as co-occurrence and other constraints that can be computationally evaluated within the context of the instance

annotation.definition: Allows identification of which elements have their cardinalities impacted by the constraint. Will not be referenced for constraints that do not affect cardinality
Used to label the constraint in OCL or in short displays incapable of displaying the full human description
Identifies the impact constraint violation has on the conformance of the instance
annotation.comment: This allows constraints to be asserted as "shall" (error) and "should" (warning)

annotation.definition: This is the text that describes the constraint in messages identifying that the constraint has been violated
annotation.comment: Should be expressed in business terms as much as possible

annotation.definition: XPath expression of constraint
annotation.comment: Elements must use "f" as the namespace prefix and must not use any other prefixes
annotation.requirements: Used in Schematron tests of the validity of the resource

annotation.definition: OCL expression of constraint

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: Captures constraints on each element within the resource

annotation.shortDefinition: The path of the element (see the formal definitions)
annotation.definition: The path identifies the element and is expressed as a "."-separated list of ancestor elements, beginning with the name of the resource

annotation.shortDefinition: Name for this particular element definition (reference target)
annotation.definition: The name of this element definition (to refer to it from other element definitions using Profile.structure.element.definition.nameReference). This is a unique name referring to a specific set of constraints applied to this element. One use of this is to provide a name to different slices of the same element
annotation.comment: The name must be unique within the profile and all imported profiles within the context of the constrained resource element. (Though to avoid confusion, uniqueness across all elements is recommended.)

annotation.shortDefinition: This element is sliced - slices follow
annotation.definition: Indicates that the element is sliced into a set of alternative definitions (there are multiple definitions on a single element in the base resource). The set of slices is any elements that come after this in the element sequence that have the same path, until a shorter path occurs (the shorter path terminates the set)
annotation.comment: The definition associated with this element definition is the master for all the slices

annotation.shortDefinition: More specific definition of the element
annotation.definition: Definition of the content of the element to provide a more specific definition than that contained for the element in the base resource
annotation.comment: The definition must be a proper constraint on the definition of the base resource

annotations.definition: A nested type in Profile: An extension defined as part of the profile

annotation.shortDefinition: Identifies the extension in this profile
annotation.definition: A unique code (within the profile) used to identify the extension
annotation.comment: Matches the portion of a reference to an extension after the # in the a url to the profile

annotation.definition: Identifies the type of context to which the extension applies

annotation.shortDefinition: Where the extension can be used in instances
annotation.definition: Identifies the types of resource or data type elements to which the extension can be applied

annotation.shortDefinition: Definition of the extension and its content
annotation.definition: Definition of the extension and its content

binding.name: BindingConformance
binding.definition: Must applications comply with this binding?

code.definition: Only codes in the specified set are allowed. If the binding is extensible, other codes may be used for concepts not covered by the bound set of codes

For greater interoperability, implementers are strongly encouraged to use the bound set of codes, however alternate codes may be used in derived profiles and implementations if necessary without being considered non-conformant

The codes in the set are an example to illustrate the meaning of the field. There is no particular preference for its use nor any assertion that the provided values are sufficient to meet implementation needs

binding.name: ConstraintSeverity
binding.definition: Must applications comply with this constraint?

code.definition: If the constraint is violated, the resource is not conformant
If the constraint is violated, the resource is conformant, but it is not necessarily following best practice.

binding.name: ResourceProfileStatus
binding.definition: The lifecycle status of a Resource Profile

code.definition: This profile is still under development
This profile is ready for normal use
This profile has been withdrawn or superceded and should no longer be used

binding.name: ExtensionContext
binding.definition: How an extension context is interpreted

code.definition: The context is all elements matching a particular resource element path
The context is all nodes matching a particular data type element path (root or repeating element) or all elements referencing a particular primitive data type (expressed as the datatype name)

The context is all nodes whose mapping to a specified reference model corresponds to a particular mapping structure. The context identifies the mapping target. The mapping should clearly identify where such an extension could be used, though this
The context is a particular extension from a particular profile. Expressed as uri#name, where uri identifies the profile and #name identifies the extension code

binding.name: SlicingRules
binding.definition: How slices are interpreted when evaluating an instance

code.definition: No additional content is allowed other than that described by the slices in this profile
Additional content is allowed anywhere in the list
Additional content is allowed, but only at the end of the list

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical id to reference this profile
annotation.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this profile when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance (should be globally unique OID, UUID, or URI)

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical id for this version of the profile
annotation.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the profile when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the profile author manually and the value should be a timestamp
annotation.requirements: There may be multiple resource versions of the profile that have this same identifier. The resource version id will change for technical reasons, whereas the stated version number needs to be under the author's control

annotation.definition: A free text natural language name identifying the Profile
annotation.comment: Not expected to be globally unique

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
annotation.definition: Details of the individual or organization who accepts responsibility for publishing the profile
annotation.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
annotation.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the profile. May also allow for contact

annotation.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher
annotation.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Natural language description of the profile
annotation.definition: A free text natural language description of the profile and its use
annotation.comment: This field can be used for things such as why the profile was written, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is *not* a rendering of the profile as conveyed in Profile.text. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

annotation.definition: A set of terms from external terminologies that may be used to assist with indexing and searching of templates.
annotation.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate profiles

annotation.shortDefinition: draft | experimental | review | production | withdrawn | superseded
annotation.definition: The status of the profile
annotation.requirements: Allows filtering of profiles that are appropriate for use vs. not

annotation.shortDefinition: If for testing purposes, not real usage
annotation.definition: This profile was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage
annotation.requirements: Allows filtering of profiles that are appropriate for use vs. not

annotation.shortDefinition: Date for this version of the profile
annotation.definition: The date that this version of the profile was published
The version of the FHIR specification on which this profile is based
annotation.comment: A profile does not need to specify the target it applies to,as profiles will often be valid across multiple versions of FHIR. FHIR tooling can determine whether a profile is consistent with a particular profile if desired

annotation.shortDefinition: A constraint on a resource or a data type
annotation.definition: A constraint statement about what contents a resource or data type may have
annotation.todo: Consider adding elements to support capturing events

annotation.definition: An extension defined as part of the profile

annotation.shortDefinition: Define code sets for coded elements
annotation.definition: Defines a linkage between a vocabulary binding name used in the profile (or expected to be used in profile importing this one) and a value set or code list

invariant.human: Must define at least one resource constraint, extension definition or binding

example.name: Resources
example.description: Base Resources defined as profiles (implementation assistance, for derivation and product development)

example.name: Tools Extensions
example.description: Extensions defined by the build tools. These extensions are candidates for being elevated into the core

search.name: extension
search.description: An extension code (use or definition)

search.name: author
search.description: Name or id of the author of the profile

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: status
search.description: The current status of the profile

search.name: name
search.description: A portion of the name of the profile

search.name: resource
search.description: A resource constrained in a profile

search.name: binding
search.description: A vocabulary binding code

search.name: word
search.description: A word somewhere in the definition of the profile or the elements in the resource. (Common words - 'and', etc. - are often not supported)

search.name: code
search.description: A code for the profile in the format uri::code (server may choose to do subsumption)

search.name: date
search.description: The profile publication date

search.name: type
search.description: Type of resource that is constrained in the profile

search.name: reference
search.description: An id of another profile referenced in the profile

annotations.shortDefinition: Who, What, When for a set of resources
annotations.definition: Provenance information that describes the activity that lead to the creation of a set of resources. This information can be used to help determine their reliability or trace where the information in them came from. The focus of the provenance resource is record keeping, audit and traceability, and not explicit statements of clinical significance
annotations.comment: Some parties may be duplicated between the target resource and its provenance. For instance, the prescriber is usually (but not always) the author of the prescription resource. This resource is defined with close consideration for W3C Provenance
annotations.rimMapping: ControlAct[isNormalAct() and subsumes(CACT, classCode) and moodCode=EVN]
annotations.committeeNotes: Sources of requirements: v2 EVN, Control Act, CDA, W3C provenance, ATNA

annotations.definition: A nested type in Provenance: An agent takes a role in an activity such that the agent can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place. An agent can be a person, a piece of software, an inanimate object, an organization, or other entities that may be ascribed responsibility

annotation.shortDefinition: author | overseer | enterer | attester | source | cc: +
annotation.definition: The role that the participant played
annotation.rimMapping: attestor: .[self::participation]/typeCode='RESP' author: .[self::participation]/typeCode='AUT' cc: .[self::participation]/typeCode='IRCP' enterer: .[self::participation]/typeCode='ENT' informant: .[self::participation]/typeCode='INF' performer: .[self::participation]/typeCode='PRF' verifier: .[self::participation]/typeCode='VRF' source: .[self::outboundRelationship]/typeCode=''
annotation.todo: Figure out how to handle: application, daemon for RIM mappings. Figure out better mapping for attestor, perhaps after RIM harmonization proposal

annotation.definition: The type of the participant
annotation.comment: If the type is "resource" then the resource itself was the participant. If the type is a type of resource, then the entity identified by the resource is the participant
annotation.rimMapping:
person: ./role[isNormalRole() and classCode='REL']/player[isNormalEntity and classCode='PER' and determinerCode='INST'] agent: ./role[isNormalRole() and classCode='ASSIGNED' and player[isNormalEntity and classCode='PSN' and determinerCode='INST']] organization: ./role[isNormalRole() and classCode='ASSIGNED' and not(player)]/scoper[isNormalEntity and classCode='ORG' and determinerCode='INST']
software: ./role[isNormalRole() and classCode='ASSIGNED']/scoper[isNormalEntity and classCode='DEV' and determinerCode='INST' and hasDomain(code, 'Software')] document: ./target[isNormalAct and subsumes('DOC', classCode) and moodCode='EVN']
annotation.todo: Not sure how to make "resource" or "record" RIM mappings work

annotation.definition: Identity of participant. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative
annotation.comment: identity may be a reference to a resource or to something else, depending on the type

annotation.definition: Human readable description of the participant

annotations.definition: A nested type in Provenance: An entity used in this activity

annotation.definition: How the entity was used during the activity
annotation.todo: Figure out how to handle: application, daemon for RIM mappings. Figure out better mapping for attestor, perhaps after RIM harmonization proposal

annotation.definition: The type of the entity. If the entity is a resource, then this is a resource type
annotation.comment: If the type is "resource" then the resource itself was the participant. If the type is a type of resource, then the entity identified by the resource is the participant
annotation.todo: Not sure how to make "resource" or "record" RIM mappings work

annotation.definition: Identity of participant. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative
annotation.comment: identity may be a reference to a resource or to something else, depending on the type

annotation.definition: Human readable description of the entity

annotation.shortDefinition: Entity is attributed to this agent
annotation.definition: The entity is attributed to an agent to express the agent's responsibility for that entity, possibly along with other agents. This description can be understood as a shorthand for saying that the agent was responsible for the activity which generated the entity

binding.name: ProvenanceAgentRole
binding.definition: The role that a provenance agent played

binding.name: ProvenanceEntityRole
binding.definition: How an entity was used in an activity

code.definition: A transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity
A derivation for which the resulting entity is a revised version of some original.
The repeat of (some or all of) an entity, such as text or image, by someone who may or may not be its original author
A primary source for a topic refers to something produced by some agent with direct experience and knowledge about the topic, at the time of the topic's study, without benefit from hindsight.

binding.name: ProvenanceAgentType
binding.definition: The type of a provenance agent

binding.name: ProvenanceEntityType
binding.definition: The type of an entity used in an activity

annotation.definition: The resource(s) that were generated by the activity described in this resource. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity
annotation.comment: Target references are usually version specific, but may not be, if a version has not been assigned or if the provenance information is part of the set of resources being maintained (i.e. a document). When using the RESTful api, the identity of the resource may not be known (especially not the version specific one); the client may either submit the resource first, and then the provenance, or it may submit both using a single transction. See the notes on transaction for further discussion
annotation.rimMapping:
./outboundRelationship[isNormalActRelationship() and typeCode=SUBJ]/target
OR
./participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=SBJ]/role
OR
./participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=SBJ]/role[isNormalRole()]/player

annotation.definition: The period during which the activity occurred
annotation.comment: The period can be a little arbitrary; where possible, the time should correspond to human assessment of the activity time

annotation.shortDefinition: When the activity was recorded / updated
annotation.definition: The instant of time at which the activity was recorded
annotation.comment: This can be a little different from the time stamp on the resource if there is a delay between recording the event and updating the provenance and target resource

annotation.definition: The reason that the activity was taking place

annotation.shortDefinition: Where the activity occurred, if relevant
annotation.definition: Where the activity occurred, if relevant
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=LOC]/role[isNormalRole() and subsumes(SDLOC, classCode)]/player[isNormalEntity and classCode="LOC" and determinerCode="INST"]

annotation.shortDefinition: Policy or plan the activity was defined by
annotation.definition: Policy or plan the activity was defined by. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc
annotation.rimMapping: ./inboundRelationship[isNormalActRelationship() and typeCode="SUBJ"]/source[isNormalAct and subsumes(POLICY, classCode) and moodCode=EVN]/text[typeCode='ED'/tel

annotation.shortDefinition: Person, organization, records, etc. involved in creating resource
annotation.definition: An agent takes a role in an activity such that the agent can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place. An agent can be a person, a piece of software, an inanimate object, an organization, or other entities that may be ascribed responsibility
annotation.comment: Several agents may be associated (i.e. has some responsibility for an activity) with an activity and vice-versa
annotation.todo: Is DRIV the appropriate semantic for "support"?

annotation.shortDefinition: An entity used in this activity
annotation.definition: An entity used in this activity

A digital signature on the target resource. The signature should reference a participant by xml:id. The signature is only added to support checking cryptographic integrity of the provenance, and not to represent workflow and clinical aspects of the signing process
annotation.comment: Whether the content is xml or json, the representation is as a base64 of the XML signature of the resource

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: location
search.description: Where the activity occurred, if relevant

search.name: start
search.description: The start of the period

search.name: partytype
search.description: Resource | Person | Application | Record | Document +

search.name: target
search.description: Target resource(s) (usually version specific)

search.name: party
search.description: Identity of agent (urn or url)

search.name: end
search.description: The end of the period, if not ongoing

annotations.shortDefinition: A description of a query with a set of parameters
annotations.definition: A description of a query with a set of parameters
A nested type in Query: If this is a response to a query

annotation.definition: Links response to source query
Outcome of processing the query
Total number of matching records
Parameters server used
To get first page (if paged)
To get previous page (if paged)
To get next page (if paged)
To get last page (if paged)

annotation.shortDefinition: Resources that are the results of the search
annotation.definition: Resources that are the results of the search
annotation.comment: Is query only used in messaging?

binding.name: QueryOutcome
binding.definition: The outcome of processing a query request

code.definition: The query was processed successfully
The query was processed successfully, but some additional limitations were added
The server refused to process the query
The server tried to process the query, but some erorr occurred

annotation.definition: Links query and it's response(s)

annotation.shortDefinition: Set of query parameters with vslues
annotation.definition: Set of query parameters with vslues
annotation.comment: Unless otherwise specified, parameters are usually strings

annotation.shortDefinition: If this is a response to a query
annotation.definition: If this is a response to a query

search.name: response
search.description: Links response to source query

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: identifier
search.description: Links query and it's response(s)

annotations.shortDefinition: A set of answers to predefined lists of questions
annotations.definition: A set of answers to predefined lists of questions. The questions may be ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the underlying questions.
annotations.requirements: To support structured, hierarchical registration of data gathered using digital forms and other questionnaires.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Questionnaire: Answers to questions on a questionnaire

annotation.shortDefinition: Code or name of the question
annotation.definition: Structured name for the question
annotation.requirements: Structured name identified the question so the answers can be identified, extracted and used.

annotation.definition: Text of the question as it may appear on screen or on a form
annotation.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each question may contain its actual question display text

annotation.definition: Single-valued answer to the question
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to retain a single-valued answers to a question

annotation.definition: One of more selections from the list of options
Reference to a valueset containing the possible options
Structured answer in the form of a FHIR Resource or datatype
annotation.requirements: Depending on the system used to compose a Questionnaire instance, it may be possible for such a system to supply answers in the form of structured FHIR data.

annotation.definition: The remark contains information about the answer given. This is additional information about the anwer the author wishes to convey, but should not be used to contain information that is part of the answer itself.
annotation.requirements: Many questionnaires allow you to include "comments" in addition to the answers given.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Questionnaire: A group of questions to a possibly similarly grouped set of question in the questionnaire

annotation.shortDefinition: Code or name of the section on a questionnaire
annotation.definition: Structured name for a section of a predefined list of questions this questionnaire is responding to.
annotation.requirements: Structured names identify the group so the answers can be identified, extracted and used.

annotation.definition: Header for the group, used for display purposes
annotation.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire with the answers, sections may have a section header

annotation.definition: Additional text for the group, used for display purposes
annotation.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each section may contain additional explanations are background text

annotation.shortDefinition: The subject this group's answers are about
annotation.definition: More specific subject this section's answers are about, details the subject given in Questionnaire
annotation.requirements: Sometimes a group of answers is about a specific participant, artifact or piece of information in the patient's care or record, e.g. a specific Problem, RelatedPerson, Allergy etc.

annotation.definition: Set of questions within this group
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to report information about the collected specimens on which the report is based

annotation.definition: A sub-group within a group
annotation.requirements: Reports can consist of complex nested groups

binding.name: QuestionnaireName
binding.definition: Structured names for forms

binding.name: QuestionName
binding.definition: Structured names for questions on the form

binding.name: QuestionnaireGroupName
binding.definition: Structured names for (sub)sections of forms

annotation.definition: The status of the questionnaire as a whole
annotation.requirements: The information on qestionnaires may possibly gathered during multiple sessions and altered after considered being finished.

annotation.definition: The date and/or time that this version of the questionnaire was authored
annotation.comment: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the collection and authoring.
annotation.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the information in the questionnaire was collected, to derive the context of the answers.

annotation.definition: The subject of the questionnaires: this is the patient that the answers apply to, but this person is not necessarily the source of information
annotation.requirements: Must know the subject context

annotation.definition: Person that collected the answers to the questions in the Questionnaire
annotation.comment: Mapping a subject's answers to multple choice options and determining what to put in textual answer is a matter of interpretation.
annotation.requirements: Need to know who interpreted the subject's answers to the questions in the questionnaire, and selected the appropriate options for answers.

annotation.shortDefinition: The person that answered the questions
annotation.definition: The person that answered the questions about the subject. Only used when this is not the subject him/herself
annotation.requirements: When anwering questions about a subject that is minor, incapable of answering or an animal, another human source is used to answer the questions
annotation.todo: source shoud be a reference to a Person resource too

annotation.shortDefinition: Name/code for a predefined list of questions
annotation.definition: Structured name for a predefined list of questions this questionnaire is responding to
annotation.requirements: Need to supply the type of form that was used to collect the answers in this questionnaire

annotation.definition: An identifier that identifier this specific set of answers
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this 80%?

annotation.shortDefinition: Primary encounter during which the answers were collected
annotation.definition: Encounter during which this questionnaireanswers were collected. When there were multiple encounters, this is the one considered most relevant to the context of the answers.
annotation.requirements: Some institutions track questionnaires under a specific encounter
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this 80%? Is this 0..*?

annotation.definition: Answers to questions on a questionnaire
annotation.requirements: Must register answers to questions

annotation.definition: A group of questions to a possibly similarly grouped set of question in the questionnaire
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to logically group answers to grouped questions

example.name: Lifelines
example.description: Real-world lifelines questionnaire (fictively taken from the patient)

search.name: author
search.description: the author of the questionnaire

search.name: authored
search.description: when the questionnaire was authored

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: status
search.description: The status of the questionnaire

search.name: subject
search.description: the subject of the questionnaire

search.name: name
search.description: name of the questionnaire

search.name: encounter
search.description: encounter during which questionnaire was authored

search.name: identifier
search.description: an identifier for the questionnaire

annotations.shortDefinition: An person that is related to a patient, but who is not a direct target of care
annotations.definition: Information about a person that is involved in the care for a patient, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process
annotations.requirements: Need to track persons related to the patient or the healthcare process.

binding.name: PatientRelationshipType
binding.definition: The nature of the relationship between a patient and the related person

annotation.shortDefinition: A Human identifier for this person
annotation.definition: Identifier for a person within a particular scope.
annotation.requirements: People are known by a variety of ids. Some institutions maintain several, and most collect identifiers for exchange with other organizations concerning the patient. Examples are national person identifier and local identifier
annotation.committeeNotes: Keeping RelatedPerson.id cardinality as a matter of safety in the same manner as Person Activate

annotation.shortDefinition: The patient this person is related to
annotation.definition: The patient this person is related to
annotation.requirements: We need to know which Patient this RelatedPerson is related to.

annotation.definition: The nature of the relationship between a patient and the related person
annotation.requirements: We need to know the relationship with the patient since it influences the interpretation of the information attributed to this person.

annotation.shortDefinition: A name associated with the person
annotation.definition: A name associated with the person
annotation.requirements: Related persons need to be identified by name, but it is uncommon to need details about multiple other names for that person

annotation.shortDefinition: A contact detail for the person
annotation.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
annotation.comment: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently, and also to help with identification
annotation.requirements: People have (primary) ways to contact them in some way such as phone, email.

annotation.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
annotation.requirements: Needed for identification of the person, in combination with (at least) name and birth date.

annotation.shortDefinition: Address where the related person can be contacted or visited
annotation.definition: Address where the related person can be contacted or visited
annotation.requirements: Need to keep track where the related person can be contacted per postal mail or visited

annotation.definition: Image of the person
annotation.requirements: Many EHR systems have the capability to capture an image of persons. Fits with newer social media usage too.

search.name: patient
search.description: The patient this person is related to

search.name: phonetic
search.description: a portion of name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: address
search.description: an address in any kind of address/part

search.name: name
search.description: a portion of name in any name part

search.name: telecom
search.description: the value in any kind of contact

search.name: gender
search.description: gender of the person

search.name: identifier
search.description: A patient Identifier

annotations.shortDefinition: Event record kept for security purposes
annotations.definition: A record of an event made for purposes of maintaining a security log. Typical uses include detection of intrusion attempts and monitoring for inappropriate usage
annotations.comment: Based on ATNA (RFC 3881)

annotations.definition: A nested type in SecurityEvent: Additional Information about the Object

annotation.definition: Name of the property
Property value

annotations.definition: A nested type in SecurityEvent: Specific instances of data or objects that have been accessed

annotation.definition: Identifies a specific instance of the participant object. The reference should always be version specific
annotation.comment: Identifier details depends on object type

annotation.definition: Identifies a specific instance of the participant object. The reference should always be version specific
Object type being audited
annotation.comment: This value is distinct from the user's role or any user relationship to the participant object
annotation.requirements: To describe the object being acted upon. In addition to queries on the subject of the action in an auditable event, it is also important to be able to query on the object type for the action

annotation.definition: Code representing the functional application role of Participant Object being audited
annotation.comment: See Rfc 3881 for rules concerning matches between role and type
annotation.requirements: For some detailed audit analysis it may be necessary to indicate a more granular type of participant, based on the application role it serves

annotation.definition: Identifier for the data life-cycle stage for the participant object
annotation.comment: This can be used to provide an audit trail for data, over time, as it passes through the system
annotation.requirements: Institutional policies for privacy and security may optionally fall under different accountability rules based on data life cycle. This provides a differentiating value for those cases

annotation.definition: Denotes policy-defined sensitivity for the Participant Object ID such as VIP, HIV status, mental health status or similar topics
annotation.comment: Values from ATNA are institution- and implementation-defined text strings (in sensitivity.text). HL7 defines confidentiality codes for records, documents etc that can also be used here
annotation.requirements: This field identifies a specific instance of an object, such as a patient, to detect/track privacy and security issues

annotation.definition: An instance-specific descriptor of the Participant Object ID audited, such as a person's name
annotation.comment: This field may be used in a query/report to identify audit events for a specific person, e.g., where multiple synonymous Participant Object IDs (patient number, medical record number, encounter number, etc.) have been used

annotation.definition: The actual query for a query-type participant object
annotation.requirements: For query events it may be necessary to capture the actual query input to the query process in order to identify the specific event. Because of differences among query implementations and data encoding for them, this is a base 64 encoded data blob. It may be subsequently decoded or interpreted by downstream audit analysis processing

annotation.definition: Additional Information about the Object

annotations.definition: A nested type in SecurityEvent: Application systems and processes

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical source location within the enterprise
annotation.definition: Logical source location within the healthcare enterprise network
annotation.comment: a hospital or other provider location within a multi-entity provider group
annotation.requirements: This value differentiates among the sites in a multi-site enterprise health information system

annotation.shortDefinition: The id of source where event originated
annotation.definition: Identifier of the source where the event originated
annotation.requirements: This field ties the event to a specific source system. It may be used to group events for analysis according to where the event occurred

annotation.shortDefinition: The type of source where event originated
annotation.definition: Code specifying the type of source where event originated
annotation.requirements: This field indicates which type of source is identified by the Audit Source ID. It is an optional value that may be used to group events for analysis according to the type of source where the event occurred

annotations.definition: A nested type in SecurityEvent: Identifies the name, action type, time, and disposition of the audited event

annotation.definition: Identifier for a family of the event
annotation.comment: e.g., a menu item, program, rule, policy, function code, application name or URL. It identifies the performed function
annotation.requirements: This identifies the audited function. For "Execute" Event Action Code audit records, this identifies the application function performed.

annotation.definition: Identifier for the category of event
annotation.requirements: This field enables queries of messages by implementation-defined event categories

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of action performed during the event
annotation.definition: Indicator for type of action performed during the event that generated the audit
annotation.requirements: This broadly indicates what kind of action was done on the Participant Object

annotation.shortDefinition: Time when the event occurred on source
annotation.definition: The time when the event occurred on the source
annotation.comment: In a distributed system, some sort of common time base, e.g., an NTP [RFC1305] server, is a good implementation tactic
annotation.requirements: This ties an event to a specific date and time. Security audits typically require a consistent time base, e.g., UTC, to eliminate time-zone issues arising from geographical distribution

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether the event succeeded or failed
annotation.definition: Indicates whether the event succeeded or failed
annotation.comment: In some cases a "success" may be partial, for example, an incomplete or interrupted transfer of a radiological study. For the purpose of establishing accountability, these distinctions are not relevant

annotation.definition: A free text description of the outcome of the event

annotations.definition: A nested type in SecurityEvent: Logical network location for application activity, if the activity has a network location

annotation.shortDefinition: Identifier for the network access point of the user device
annotation.definition: An identifier for the network access point of the user device for the audit event
annotation.comment: This could be a device id, IP address or some other identifier associated with a device
annotation.requirements: This datum identifies the user's network access point, which may be distinct from the server that performed the action. It is an optional value that may be used to group events recorded on separate servers for analysis of a specific network access point's data access across all servers

annotation.shortDefinition: The type of network access point
annotation.definition: An identifier for the type of network access point that originated the audit event
annotation.requirements: This datum identifies the type of network access point identifier of the user device for the audit event. It is an optional value that may be used to group events recorded on separate servers for analysis of access according to a network access point's type

annotations.definition: A nested type in SecurityEvent: A person, a hardware device or software process

annotation.definition: Specification of the role(s) the user plays when performing the event. Usually the codes used in this element are local codes defined by the role-based access control security system used in the local context
annotation.requirements: This value ties an audited event to a user's role(s). It is an optional value that might be used to group events for analysis by user functional role categories

annotation.definition: Direct reference to a resource that identifies the participant
annotation.requirements: This field ties an audit event to a specific resource

annotation.definition: Unique identifier for the user actively participating in the event
annotation.comment: a unique value within the Audit Source ID. For node-based authentication -- where only the system hardware or process, but not a human user, is identified -- User ID would be the node name
annotation.requirements: This field ties an audit event to a specific user

annotation.shortDefinition: User id used by authentication system
annotation.definition: User identifier text string from authentication system. This identifier would be one known to a common authentication system (e.g., single sign-on), if available
annotation.requirements: In some situations a user may authenticate with one identity but, to access a specific application system, may use a synonymous identify. For example, some "single sign on" implementations will do this. The alternative identifier would then be the original identify used for authentication, and the User ID is the one known to and used by the application

annotation.definition: Human-meaningful name for the user
annotation.requirements: The User ID and Authorization User ID may be internal or otherwise obscure values. This field assists the auditor in identifying the actual user

annotation.definition: Indicator that the user is or is not the requestor, or initiator, for the event being audited.
annotation.comment: There can only be one initiator. If the initiator is not clear, then do noe choose any one participant as the initiator
annotation.requirements: This value is used to distinguish between requestor-users and recipient-users. For example, one person may initiate a report-output to be sent to a another user

annotation.definition: Type of media involved. Used when the event is about exporting/importing onto media
annotation.requirements: Usually, this is used instead of specifying a network address. This field is not used for Media Id (i.e. the serial number of a CD)
annotation.todo: Do we need an element for Media Id (as opposed to type)

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical network location for application activity
annotation.definition: Logical network location for application activity, if the activity has a network location

binding.name: SecurityEventAction
binding.definition: Indicator for type of action performed during the event that generated the audit.

code.definition: Create a new database object, such as Placing an Order.
Display or print data, such as a Doctor Census
Update data, such as Revise Patient Information
Delete items, such as a doctor master file record
Perform a system or application function such as log-on, program execution or use of an object's method, or perform a query/search operation

binding.name: DicomMediaType
binding.definition: Used when the event is about exporting/importing onto media

binding.name: SecurityEventSubType
binding.definition: Sub-type of event

binding.name: SecurityEventParticipantNetworkType
binding.definition: the type of network access point that originated the audit event

code.definition: Machine Name, including DNS name
IP Address
Telephone Number
Email address
URI (User directory, HTTP-PUT, ftp, etc.)

binding.name: SecurityEventType
binding.definition: Type of event

binding.name: DicomRoleId
binding.definition: Role(s) the user plays (from RBAC)

binding.name: DicomObjectIdType
binding.definition: Describes the identifier

binding.name: SecurityEventObjectSensitivity
binding.definition: The sensitivity of an object in a secuity event resource. May also encompass confidentiality and rudimentary access control

binding.name: SecurityEventObjectRole
binding.definition: Code representing the functional application role of Participant Object being audited

code.definition: This object is the patient that is the subject of care related to this event. It is identifiable by patient ID or equivalent. The patient may be either human or animal

This is a location identified as related to the event. This is usually the location where the event took place. Note that for shipping, the usual events are arrival at a location or departure from a location.

This object is any kind of persistent document created as a result of the event. This could be a paper report, film, electronic report, DICOM Study, etc. Issues related to medical records life cycle management are conveyed elsewhere.
A logical object related to the event. (Deprecated)
This is any configurable file used to control creation of documents. Examples include the objects maintained by the HL7 Master File transactions, Value Sets, etc.
A human participant not otherwise identified by some other category

Typically a licensed person who is providing or performing care related to the event, generally a physician. The key distinction between doctor and practitioner is with regards to their role, not the licensing. The doctor is the human who actually performed the work. The practitioner is the human or organization that is responsible for the work.
A person or system that is being notified as part of the event. This is relevant in situations where automated systems provide notifications to other parties when an event took place.
Insurance company, or any other organization who accepts responsibility for paying for the healthcare event.
A person or active system object involved in the event with a security role.
A person or system object involved in the event with the authority to modify security roles of other objects.
A passive object, such as a role table, that is relevant to the event.
(deprecated) Relevant to certain RBAC security methodologies.

Any person or organization responsible for providing care. This encompasses all forms of care, licensed or otherwise, and all sorts of teams and care groups. Note, the distinction between practitioners and the doctor that actually provided the care to the patient.
The source or destination for data transfer, when it does not match some other role.
A source or destination for data transfer, that acts as an archive, database, or similar role.
An object that holds schedule information. This could be an appointment book, availability information, etc.
An organization or person that is the recipient of services. This could be an organization that is buying services for a patient, or a person that is buying services for an animal.
An order, task, work item, procedure step, or other description of work to be performed. E.g., a particular instance of an MPPS.
A list of jobs or a system that provides lists of jobs. E.g., an MWL SCP.
An object that specifies or controls the routing or delivery of items. For example, a distribution list is the routing criteria for mail. The items delivered may be documents, jobs, or other objects.
The contents of a query. This is used to capture the contents of any kind of query. For security surveillance purposes knowing the queries being made is very important.

binding.name: SecurityEventObjectType
binding.definition: Code for the participant object type being audited

code.definition: System Object

binding.name: SecurityEventObjectLifecycle
binding.definition: Identifier for the data life-cycle stage for the participant object

code.definition: Origination / Creation
Import / Copy from original
Access / Use
Aggregation, summarization, derivation
Export / Copy to target
Receipt of disclosure
Logical deletion
Permanent erasure / Physical destruction

binding.name: DicomAlertType
binding.definition: The type of source where event originated

binding.name: SecurityEventSourceType
binding.definition: Code specifying the type of source where event originated

binding.name: SecurityEventOutcome
binding.definition: Indicates whether the event succeeded or failed

code.definition: The operation completed successfully (whether with warnings or not)
The action was not successful due to some kind of catered for error (often equivalent to an HTTP 400 response)
The action was not successful due to some kind of unexpected error (often equivalent to an HTTP 500 response)
An error of such magnitude occurred that the system is not longer availkable for use (i.e. the system died)

annotation.definition: Identifies the name, action type, time, and disposition of the audited event
annotation.requirements: The event must be identified

annotation.shortDefinition: A person, a hardware device or software process
annotation.definition: A person, a hardware device or software process
annotation.comment: There may be more than one user per event, for example, in cases of actions initiated by one user for other users, or in events that involve more than one user, hardware device, or system process. However, only one user may be the initiator/requestor for the event
annotation.requirements: The event has one or more active participants

annotation.definition: Application systems and processes
annotation.comment: Since multi-tier, distributed, or composite applications make source identification ambiguous, this collection of fields may repeat for each application or process actively involved in the event. For example, multiple value-sets can identify participating web servers, application processes, and database server threads in an n-tier distributed application. Passive event participants, e.g., low-level network transports, need not be identified
annotation.requirements: The event is reported by one source

annotation.shortDefinition: Specific instances of data or objects that have been accessed
annotation.definition: Specific instances of data or objects that have been accessed
annotation.comment: required unless the values for Event Identification, Active Participant Identification, and Audit Source Identification are sufficient to document the entire auditable event. Because events may have more than one participant object, this group can be a repeating set of values.
annotation.requirements: The event may have other objects involved

search.name: site
search.description: Logical source location within the enterprise

search.name: desc
search.description: Instance-specific descriptor for Object

search.name: type
search.description: Type of event

search.name: date
search.description: Time when the event occurred on source

search.name: reference
search.description: Specific instance of resource (e.g. versioned)

search.name: authid
search.description: User id used by authentication system

search.name: identity
search.description: Specific instance of object (e.g. versioned)

search.name: patientid
search.description: The id of the patient (one of multiple kinds of participations)

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: source
search.description: The id of source where event originated

search.name: address
search.description: Identifier for the network access point of the user device

search.name: subtype
search.description: Sub-type of event

search.name: name
search.description: Human-meaningful name for the user

search.name: action
search.description: Type of action performed during the event

search.name: object-type
search.description: Object type being audited

search.name: user
search.description: Unique identifier for the user

annotations.shortDefinition: Sample for analysis
annotations.definition: Sample for analysis
A nested type in Specimen: Details concerning the specimen collection

annotation.definition: Person who collected the specimen
To communicate any details or issues encountered during the specimen collection procedure.
Time when specimen was collected from subject - the physiologically relevant time
The quantity of specimen collected; for instance the volume of a blood sample, or the physical measurement of an anatomic pathology sample
A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure

annotation.shortDefinition: Site of the source of the specimen
annotation.definition: Anatomical location from which the specimen should be collected

annotations.definition: A nested type in Specimen: Parent specimen from which the focal specimen was a component

annotation.definition: Whether this relationship is to a parent or to a child
The specimen resource that is the target of this relationship

annotations.definition: A nested type in Specimen: Details concerning treatment and processing steps for the specimen

annotation.definition: Textual description of procedure
A coded value specifying the procedure used to process the specimen
Specimen additive

annotations.definition: A nested type in Specimen: The container holding the specimen. May be recursive; ie blood in tube in tray in rack

annotation.definition: Id for container. There may be muliple; a manufacturer's bar code, lab assigned identifier, etc
Textual description of container
The type of container associated with the specimen (eg slide, aliquot, etc)
The capacity (volume or other measure the container may contain.
The quantity of specimen in the container; may be volume, dimensions, or other appropriate measurements, depending on the specimen type
Additive associated with the container

binding.name: HierarchicalRelationshipType
binding.definition: Type indicating if this is a parent or child relationship

code.definition: The target resource is the parent of the focal specimen resource
The target resource is the child of the focal specimen resource

binding.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
binding.definition: The technique that is used to perform the procedure

binding.name: SpecimenTreatmentProcedure
binding.definition: Type indicating the technique used to process the specimen

binding.name: SpecimenType
binding.definition: The type of the specimen. This is sometimes called the "matrix"

binding.name: SpecimenContainerType
binding.definition: Type of specimen container

annotation.definition: Id for specimen
The type of the specimen. This is sometimes called the "matrix"
annotation.comment: The type can change the way that a spceimen is handled, and drives what kind of analyses can properly be performed on the specimen. It is frequently used in diagnostic work flow decision making systems

annotation.definition: Parent specimen from which the focal specimen was a component
The subject of the report
annotation.requirements: Must know the subject context

annotation.definition: The identifier(s) assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.
Time when specimen was received for processing or testing
Details concerning the specimen collection
Details concerning treatment and processing steps for the specimen
The container holding the specimen. May be recursive; ie blood in tube in tray in rack

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: subject
search.description: the subject of the specimen

binding.name: SubstanceQuantityMode
binding.definition: Mode of the quantity element

binding.name: SubstanceStatus
binding.definition: Substance status

binding.name: SubstanceType
binding.definition: Type of the substance

annotation.definition: Identifier of the substance
Name of the substance
Type of the substance
Description of the substance
Substance status
When the substance is active or effective
The amount of the substance
A substance can be composed of other substances
Indicates whether the substance quantity (used for ingredients) are absolute values or values relative to each other (percentages)

search.name: _id

search.name: name
search.description: The name of the substance

search.name: type
search.description: The type of the substance

annotations.shortDefinition: A supply - request and provision
annotations.definition: A supply - request and provision
A nested type in Supply: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of a supply dispensed.

annotation.definition: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility. This is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.
A code specifying the state of the dispense event.
Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.
The amount of supply that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

annotation.shortDefinition: Medication, Substance, or Device being supplied
annotation.definition: Identifies the medication or substance being dispensed. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or substance or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
The individual reponsible for dispensing the medication
The time the dispense event occurred.
The time the dispense event occurred.
Identification of the facility/location where the Supply was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.
Identifies the person who picked up the Supply.

binding.name: SupplyItemType
binding.definition: The actual item being supplied

binding.name: SupplyStatus
binding.definition: Status of the supply

binding.name: SupplyType
binding.definition: Category of supply

annotation.shortDefinition: The kind of supply (central, non-stock, etc)
annotation.definition: Category of supply
Unique identifier for this kind of supply
annotation.comment: This is assigned by the orderer, and used to refer to this order in other external standards

annotation.definition: Status of the supply

annotation.shortDefinition: Medication, Substance, or Device requested to be supplied
annotation.definition: The item which was ordered
A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.
Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of a supply dispensed.

search.name: _id

search.name: name
search.description: The kind of supply (central, non-stock, etc)

search.name: dispenseid
