search.description: Unique identifier

annotations.shortDefinition: A set of codes drawn from one or more code systems
annotations.definition: A value set specifies a set of codes drawn from one or more code systems
A nested type in ValueSet: When value set defines it's own codes

annotation.shortDefinition: URI to identify the code system
annotation.definition: URI to identify the code system

annotation.shortDefinition: If code comparison is case sensitive
annotation.definition: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this systemare compared to each other
annotation.comment: If this value is missing, then it is not specified whether a code system is case sensitive or not. When the rule is not known, Postel's law should be followed: produce codes with the correct case, and accept codes in any case. This element is primarily provided to support validation software

annotation.definition: Concepts in the code system

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Codes in the value set

annotation.definition: System value for the code

annotation.shortDefinition: Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code
annotation.definition: Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code
User display for the concept
Codes contained in this concept

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Include one or more codes from a code system

annotation.shortDefinition: The system the codes come from
annotation.definition: The code system from which the selected codes come from
annotation.comment: See [[Coding.system]] for further documentation

annotation.shortDefinition: Specific version of the code system referred to
annotation.definition: The version of the code system that the codes are selected from
annotation.comment: This is used when selecting the descendents of a concept - they may change between versions. If no version is specified, then the exact contents of the value set may not be known until a context of use binds it to a particular version

annotation.definition: Specifies a code or concept to be included or excluded
annotation.comment: expressions are allowed if defined by the underlying code system

annotation.shortDefinition: Select codes/concepts by their properties (including relationships)
annotation.definition: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they must all be true.
annotation.comment: Selecting codes by specifying filters based on properties is only possible where the underlying code system defines appropriate properties. Note that in some cases, the underlying code system defines the logical concepts but not the literal codes for the concepts. In such cases, the literal definitions may be provided by a third party

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they must all be true.

annotation.shortDefinition: A property defined by the code system
annotation.definition: A code that identifies a property defined in the code system
The kind of operation to perform as part of the filter criteria

annotation.shortDefinition: Code from the system, or regex criteria
annotation.definition: The match value may be either a code defined by the system, or a string value which is used a regex match on the literal string of the property value
annotation.comment: Use regex matching with care - full regex matching on every SNOMED-CT term is prohibitive, for example

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: When value set includes codes from elsewhere

annotation.shortDefinition: Import the contents of another value set
annotation.definition: Includes the contents of the referenced value set as part of the contents of this value set

annotation.shortDefinition: Include one or more codes from a code system
annotation.definition: Include one or more codes from a code system
annotation.comment: If there are no codes or filters, the entire code system is included

annotation.definition: Exclude one or more codes from the value set
annotation.comment: usually this is used to selectively exclude codes that were included by subsumption in the inclusions

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Concepts in the code system

annotation.definition: Code that identifies concept

annotation.shortDefinition: If this code is not for use as a real concept
annotation.definition: If this code is not for use as a real concept

annotation.shortDefinition: Text to Display to the user
annotation.definition: Text to Display to the user
Formal Definition
Child Concepts (is-a / contains)

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: When value set is an expansion

annotation.definition: Time valueset expansion happened
Codes in the value set

binding.name: CodeSelectionMode
binding.definition: The way in which the code is selected

code.definition: Only this code is selected
Only the immediate children (codes with a is_a relationship) are selected, but not this code itself
All descendants of this code are selected, but not this code itself
This code and any descendants are selected
All codes from the specified code system

binding.name: ValueSetStatus
binding.definition: The lifecycle status of a Value Set

code.definition: This valueset is still under development
This valueset is ready for normal use
This valueset has been withdrawn or superceded and should no longer be used

binding.name: FilterOperator
binding.definition: The kind of operation to perform as part of a property based filter

code.definition: The property value has the concept specified by the value
The property value has a concept that has an is_a relationship with the value
The property value has a concept that does not have an is_a relationship with the value
The property value representation matches the regex specified in the value

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical id to reference this value set
annotation.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance (should be globally unique OID, UUID, or URI)

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical id for this version of the value set
annotation.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the profile author manually and the value should be a timestamp
annotation.comment: There may be multiple resource versions of the value set that have this same identifier

annotation.shortDefinition: Informal name for this value set
annotation.definition: A free text natural language name describing the value set
annotation.comment: Not expected to be unique
annotation.requirements: Support human navigation

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
annotation.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the value set
annotation.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
annotation.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the profile. May also allow for contact

annotation.definition: Contacts of the publisher to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher
annotation.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Human language description of the value set
annotation.definition: A free text natural language description of the use of the value set - reason for definition, conditions of use, etc.
annotation.comment: The description is not intended to describe the semantics of the Value Set - there are no intrinsic semantics separate from the codes contained in its expansion. The description should capture its intended use, which is needed for ensuring integrity for its use in models across future changes.
annotation.requirements: Human understandibility

annotation.shortDefinition: draft | experimental | review | production | withdrawn | superseded
annotation.definition: The status of the value set
annotation.comment: Allows filtering of valuesets that are appropriate for use vs. not
annotation.requirements: Identify when/if the value set should be used.

annotation.shortDefinition: If for testing purposes, not real usage
annotation.definition: This valueset was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage
annotation.comment: Allows filtering of valuesets that are appropriate for use vs. not

annotation.definition: The date that the value set status was last changed
annotation.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the value set
annotation.requirements: Need to know when a value set was first legal for use or became withdrawn or replaced.

annotation.shortDefinition: When value set defines it's own codes
annotation.definition: When value set defines it's own codes

annotation.shortDefinition: When value set includes codes from elsewhere
annotation.definition: When value set includes codes from elsewhere

annotation.shortDefinition: When value set is an expansion
annotation.definition: When value set is an expansion

invariant.human: A value set with only one import must also have an include and/or an exclude unless the value set defines it's own codes
invariant.xpath: not(exists(f:compose)) or (count(f:compose/f:import)!=1 or exists(f:compose/f:include) or exists(f:compose/f:exclude) or exists(f:define))

invariant.human: A defined code system (if present) must have a different identifier to the value set itself
Value set must contain either a define, a compose, or an expansion element

search.name: system
search.description: the system for any codes defined by this value set

search.name: _id
search.description: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

search.name: status
search.description: the status of the value set

search.name: description
search.description: Human language description of the value set

search.name: name
search.description: a portion of the name of the value set

search.name: code
search.description: a code defined in the value set

search.name: identifier
search.description: the identifier of the value set

search.name: reference
search.description: a code system included or excluded in the value set or an imported value set

search.name: version
search.description: the version identifier of the value set

annotations.shortDefinition: Resource for capturing binary data

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.definition: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes

binding.name: DataAbsentReason
binding.definition: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing

code.definition: The value is not known
The source human does not know the value
There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known
The workflow didn't lead to this value being known
The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons
code.comment: Using masked may be breach of security or confidentiality, but there are times when its use is required to support alternate workflows for gaining access to denied information.

code.definition: The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element
The content of the data is represented as text
Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available

binding.name: DataType
binding.definition: The type of an element - one of the FHIR data types

binding.name: FHIRDefinedType
binding.definition: Either a resource or a data type

binding.name: LanguageAbilityMode
binding.definition: A value representing the person's method of expression of this language

binding.name: LanguageAbilityProficiency
binding.definition: A code that describes how well the language is spoken

binding.name: MaritalStatus
binding.definition: The domestic partnership status of a person

binding.name: MessageEvent
binding.definition: One of the message events defined as part of FHIR

binding.name: ObservationBodySite
binding.definition: Codes for human and animal body sites

binding.name: ObservationStatus
binding.definition: Codes providing the status of an observation

code.definition: The existence of the observation is registered, but there is no result yet available
This is an initial or interim observation: data may be incomplete or unverified
The observation is complete and verified by an authorised person
The observation has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by an authorised person
The observation is unavailable because the measurement was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted")
The observation has been withdrawn following previous Final release

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.definition: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR

binding.name: SpecialValues
binding.definition: A set of generally useful codes defined so they can be included in value sets

code.definition: Boolean true
Boolean false
The content is greater than zero, but too small to be quantified
The specific quantity is not known, but is known to be non-zero and is not specified because it makes up the bulk of the material
code.comment: used in formulations (e.g. 'Add 10mg of ingredient X, 50mg of ingredient Y, and sufficient quantity of water to 100mL.' This code would be used to express the quantity of water. )

code.definition: The value is no longer available
The are no known applicable values in this context
code.comment: The existence of this subject to review

event.definition: Provide a simple observation or update a previously provided simple observation
Indicates that a medication has been recorded against the patient's record
Response with the result of processing the query

usage.notes: Used when queries are performed asynchronously

event.definition: Notification of a change to an administrative resource (either create or update). Note that there is no delete, though some administrative resources have status or period elements for this use
Request to perform a query according to the attached query resource
Change the status of a Medication Administration to show that it is complete.
Someone wishes to record that the record of administration of a medication is in error and should be ignored.
Provide a diagnostic report, or update a previously provided diagnostic report

annotations.definition: A whole number in the range 0 to 2^64-1, optionally represented in hex, a uuid, an oid or any other combination of lower-case letters a-z, numerals, "-" and ".", with a length limit of 36 characters
annotations.comment: RFC 4122

annotations.definition: A stream of bytes
annotations.comment: A stream of bytes, base64 encoded

annotations.definition: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a timezone must be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds may be provided but may also be ignored. Dates must be valid dates.
A whole number
annotations.comment: 32 bit number; for values larger than this, use decimal

annotations.definition: An oid represented as a URI
annotations.comment: RFC 3001. See also ISO/IEC 8824:1990

annotations.definition: A sequence of Unicode characters
annotations.comment: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

annotations.definition: Value of true or false
A UUID, represented as a URI
annotations.comment: See The Open Group, CDE 1.1 Remote Procedure Call specification, Appendix A.

annotations.definition: A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no timezone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates must be valid dates.
String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
annotations.comment: see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_identifier

annotations.definition: An instant in time - known at least to the second
annotations.comment: Note: For system observed times, not human-reported times (see date and dateTime below). Timezone is always required

annotations.definition: A rational number with implicit precision
annotations.comment: Do not use a IEEE type floating point type, instead use something that works like a true decimal, with inbuilt precision (e.g. Java BigInteger)

annotations.definition: A string of xhtml data, with a <div> as root
annotations.comment: Can contain only the basic html formatting elements described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images, and internally contained style attributes.

annotations.definition: A reference to another element
annotations.comment: References an element that has been marked with an 'id' attribute with the corresponding value.
